column6: 典型中式英语：'The phone has very big success.' 纠正：'The phone achieved tremendous success.'

column1: 一位中国留学生在国外找到了一份实习工作，觉得这是一个提升自己的绝佳机会。
column2: 留学生认为这份实习是一个非常好的机会。
column3: This internship is a @ @ for her to gain experience.
column4: This internship is a 「tremendous opportunity」 for her to gain experience.
column5: 这次实习对她来说是一个「绝佳的机会」来积累经验。
column6: 典型中式英语：'This is a very good chance.' 纠正：'This is a tremendous opportunity.'

column1: 一位中国游客在欧洲旅行时，体验了当地丰富的历史文化，感到非常满足。
column2: 游客觉得这次旅行是一次非常棒的经历。
column3: The trip to Europe was a @ @ for him.
column4: The trip to Europe was a 「tremendous experience」 for him.
column5: 欧洲之旅对他来说是一次「极好的经历」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'The trip is very great experience.' 纠正：'The trip was a tremendous experience.'

column1: 在一个历史课堂上，老师正在讲解人类早期社会的发展，提到古代的美索不达米亚地区。
column2: 想表达一个社会在很久以前就有了复杂的文化和城市系统。
column3: The @ @ was known for its advanced writing systems and urban planning.
column4: The 「ancient civilization」 was known for its advanced writing systems and urban planning.
column5: 这个「古老文明」以其先进的书写系统和城市规划而闻名。
column6: 中式英语：'Old society had good culture.' 纠正：'The ancient civilization developed a sophisticated culture.'

column1: 在一场关于全球化的辩论中，学生讨论科技如何影响当今社会。
column2: 想表达当今社会因科技而变得更加先进和互联。
column3: Technology has transformed @ @ into a global network of interconnected societies.
column4: Technology has transformed 「modern civilization」 into a global network of interconnected societies.
column5: 科技已将「现代文明」转变为一个相互联系的全球社会网络。
column6: 中式英语：'Now society is very modern because of technology.' 纠正：'Modern civilization has been reshaped by technological advancements.'

column1: 在博物馆的展览中，导游向游客介绍古代中美洲的文化遗产。
column2: 想说明某个古代社会有独特的建筑和宗教传统。
column3: The @ @ was renowned for its intricate pyramids and astronomical knowledge.
column4: The 「Mayan civilization」 was renowned for its intricate pyramids and astronomical knowledge.
column5: 这个「玛雅文明」因其精致的金字塔和天文知识而闻名。
column6: 中式英语：'Maya people had great buildings.' 纠正：'The Mayan civilization is celebrated for its architectural achievements.'

column1: 在一场国际文化交流活动中，演讲者提到中国悠久的历史。
column2: 想表达某个社会拥有几千年的文化传承和哲学思想。
column3: The @ @ has contributed profound philosophical ideas to the world for millennia.
column4: The 「Chinese civilization」 has contributed profound philosophical ideas to the world for millennia.
column5: 这个「中华文明」几千年来为世界贡献了深刻的哲学思想。
column6: 中式英语：'China’s society is very old and has good ideas.' 纠正：'Chinese civilization has a rich legacy of philosophical contributions.'

column1: 在一次家庭聚会上，父母教导孩子如何礼貌待人。
column2: 想表达礼貌和尊重是社会交往中的重要品质。
column3: Treating others with respect is an @ @ @ in any society.
column4: Treating others with respect is an 「act of civilization」 in any society.
column5: 尊重他人是任何社会中的一种「文明行为」。
column6: 中式英语：'Be polite is good society.' 纠正：'Politeness is a fundamental act of civilization.'

column1: 在一场关于公共行为的讨论中，市民谈到保持环境整洁的重要性。
column2: 想说明整洁和遵守规则是社会文明的体现。
column3: Keeping public spaces clean is a @ @ @ for any community.
column4: Keeping public spaces clean is a 「mark of civilization」 for any community.
column5: 保持公共场所清洁是任何社区的一种「文明标志」。
column6: 中式英语：'Clean place is civilized society.' 纠正：'Maintaining clean public spaces is a mark of civilization.'

column1: 你在一家餐厅点了一份牛排，但发现牛排非常硬，咬起来很费力。你向服务员抱怨。
column2: 想表达食物难以咀嚼，质地不好，影响用餐体验。
column3: The steak was so @ @ that I could barely chew it.
column4: The steak was so 「tough meat」 that I could barely chew it.
column5: 这块牛排是如此「难以咀嚼的肉」以至于我几乎咬不动。
column6: 典型中式英语：'The meat is very hard to eat.' 纠正：'The meat is too tough to chew.'

column1: 你在一家手工艺品店挑选皮革材料，发现有些皮革特别硬，不适合做柔软的手提包。
column2: 想描述材料坚硬，难以加工或使用。
column3: This @ @ is too hard to work with for a soft bag.
column4: This 「tough leather」 is too hard to work with for a soft bag.
column5: 这种「坚硬的皮革」太硬了，不适合做柔软的包。
column6: 典型中式英语：'This leather is very hard.' 纠正：'This leather is too tough to work with.'

column1: 你是一个团队领导，需要在两个优秀员工中选择一个晋升，但他们各有优势，难以抉择。
column2: 想表达决策过程复杂，难以做出选择。
column3: Choosing between them was a @ @ because both were highly qualified.
column4: Choosing between them was a 「tough decision」 because both were highly qualified.
column5: 在他们之间做出选择是一个「艰难的决定」，因为两人资质都很高。
column6: 典型中式英语：'This is a hard choice.' 纠正：'This is a tough decision.'

column1: 你正在准备一场重要的考试，但时间紧迫，内容繁多，感到压力很大。
column2: 想表达任务艰巨，难以在短时间内完成。
column3: Preparing for the exam in such a short time is a @ @.
column4: Preparing for the exam in such a short time is a 「tough challenge」.
column5: 在这么短的时间内准备考试是一个「艰巨的挑战」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'This exam is very difficult to prepare.' 纠正：'Preparing for this exam is a tough challenge.'

column1: 你的朋友在公司裁员中失去了工作，但他依然积极寻找新机会，展现出强大的心理素质。
column2: 想表达一个人在逆境中坚强、不轻易放弃。
column3: Despite losing his job, he showed a @ @ and kept looking for opportunities.
column4: Despite losing his job, he showed a 「tough character」 and kept looking for opportunities.
column5: 尽管失去了工作，他展现了「坚强的性格」，继续寻找机会。
column6: 典型中式英语：'He is very strong after losing job.' 纠正：'He has a tough character after losing his job.'

column1: 你在健身房看到一个教练，尽管训练强度很大，但他始终保持冷静和鼓励的态度。
column2: 想表达一个人在高压环境下保持坚韧和积极。
column3: The coach maintained a @ @ even during the intense training session.
column4: The coach maintained a 「tough attitude」 even during the intense training session.
column5: 教练在高强度的训练中依然保持「坚韧的态度」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'The coach is very strong in training.' 纠正：'The coach has a tough attitude during training.'

column1: 你走进一家现代化的购物中心，入口处的玻璃门在你靠近时会自行打开，无需推拉。
column2: 描述一种便利的科技体验，强调设备能够感知并自动完成动作，减少人工操作。
column3: The @ @ at the mall opened as I approached.
column4: The 「automatic door」 at the mall opened as I approached.
column5: 商场里的「自动门」在我靠近时打开了。
column6: 典型中式英语：'The door open automatic when I come.' 纠正：'The automatic door opens when I approach.'（注意主语和动词时态，以及‘automatic’作为形容词的正确位置。）

column1: 你在朋友的车里，注意到他换挡时不需要手动操作离合器，驾驶过程更轻松。
column2: 描述车辆的先进功能，强调自动化的驾驶体验如何提升舒适度。
column3: His car has an @ @, so shifting gears is effortless.
column4: His car has an 「automatic transmission」, so shifting gears is effortless.
column5: 他的车有「自动变速器」，所以换挡很轻松。
column6: 典型中式英语：'His car is automatic change gear.' 纠正：'His car has an automatic transmission.'（避免直接翻译‘自动换挡’，使用英语中的固定搭配。）

column1: 你在课堂上被老师突然点名回答问题，尽管没有准备，但你迅速给出了一个答案。
column2: 描述一种下意识的反应，强调人在特定情境下会不经思考地做出回应。
column3: When the teacher called my name, I gave an @ @ without thinking.
column4: When the teacher called my name, I gave an 「automatic response」 without thinking.
column5: 当老师叫到我的名字时，我不假思索地给出了一个「自动反应」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'I answer automatic when teacher call me.' 纠正：'I gave an automatic response when the teacher called me.'（注意‘automatic’修饰名词，且动词搭配需准确。）

column1: 你每天早上起床后都会先刷牙，这已经成为一种固定的习惯，几乎不需要提醒自己。
column2: 描述日常生活中根深蒂固的习惯，强调行为的自动化特性。
column3: Brushing my teeth in the morning is an @ @ for me.
column4: Brushing my teeth in the morning is an 「automatic behavior」 for me.
column5: 早上刷牙对我来说是一种「自动行为」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'I automatic brush teeth every morning.' 纠正：'Brushing my teeth every morning is an automatic behavior.'（避免直接将‘automatic’用于动词，改为修饰名词。）

column1: 在一个温馨的家庭聚会上，李明为他母亲的50岁生日准备了一份特别的礼物。桌上摆满了蛋糕和鲜花，家人们围坐在一起，期待着惊喜的时刻。
column2: 李明想表达对母亲多年养育之恩的感激，特意挑选了一件她喜欢的礼物，希望让她感到被爱和重视。
column3: Li Ming decided to @ @ @ to his mother for her 50th birthday.
column4: Li Ming decided to 「give a gift」 to his mother for her 50th birthday.
column5: 李明决定为母亲50岁生日「送一份礼物」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'Li Ming wants to send his mother a gift.' 纠正：'Send'在此语境中不自然，英语中更常用'give'表示送礼物。应改为：'Li Ming wants to give his mother a gift.'

column1: 在圣诞节的早晨，孩子们兴奋地跑下楼，发现圣诞树下堆满了包装精美的盒子。他们迫不及待地撕开包装纸，露出开心的笑脸。
column2: 孩子们期待收到节日礼物，这些礼物象征着家人之间的爱和节日的欢乐气氛。
column3: The children were thrilled to @ @ @ under the Christmas tree.
column4: The children were thrilled to 「receive a gift」 under the Christmas tree.
column5: 孩子们兴奋地在圣诞树下「收到礼物」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'The children got a gift.' 纠正：'Get'虽然在某些情况下可用，但'receive'更正式且常见于描述收到礼物。应改为：'The children received a gift.'

column1: 在学校的音乐会上，15岁的张薇用小提琴演奏了一首复杂的曲子，观众席上的每个人都被她的表演深深震撼，掌声经久不息。
column2: 张薇在音乐方面的天赋让人们惊叹，她似乎天生就懂得如何用琴声表达情感。
column3: Everyone agreed that Zhang Wei @ @ @ for music.
column4: Everyone agreed that Zhang Wei 「had a gift」 for music.
column5: 大家都认为张薇在音乐方面「有天赋」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'Zhang Wei is very talent in music.' 纠正：'Talent'是不可数名词，且表达不自然。应改为：'Zhang Wei has a gift for music.'

column1: 在一次国际象棋比赛中，年轻的选手陈浩击败了一位经验丰富的冠军。他的冷静和精准的棋路让评委们赞不绝口。
column2: 陈浩在象棋上的天赋让他能够在高压比赛中脱颖而出，展现出超乎年龄的智慧。
column3: Chen Hao’s @ @ for chess amazed the judges.
column4: Chen Hao’s 「natural gift」 for chess amazed the judges.
column5: 陈浩在象棋上的「天赋」让评委们惊叹。
column6: 典型中式英语：'Chen Hao has a talent gift for chess.' 纠正：'Talent'和'gift'重复且不自然，'natural gift'是更地道的搭配。应改为：'Chen Hao has a natural gift for chess.'

column1: 一家公司正在讨论新项目的投资规模，管理层希望了解项目的潜在影响力。
column2: 描述项目涉及的范围和重要性，强调其广泛性。
column3: The project is planned on a @ @, aiming to impact multiple regions.
column4: The project is planned on a 「large scale」, aiming to impact multiple regions.
column5: 该项目计划以「大规模」进行，旨在影响多个地区。
column6: 典型中式英语：'The project is very big scale.' 纠正：'The project is planned on a large scale.'

column1: 一位科学家在会议上介绍气候变化的影响，强调其全球性。
column2: 描述某现象的影响范围遍及全球，突出其重要性和广泛性。
column3: Climate change is a problem on a @ @, requiring international cooperation.
column4: Climate change is a problem on a 「global scale」, requiring international cooperation.
column5: 气候变化是一个「全球范围」的问题，需要国际合作。
column6: 典型中式英语：'Climate change is whole world problem.' 纠正：'Climate change is a problem on a global scale.'

column1: 一个家庭主妇在厨房准备烘焙蛋糕，需要精确测量面粉的重量。
column2: 描述使用工具来确保食材的准确重量，以保证食谱的成功。
column3: She used a @ @ to measure the flour precisely.
column4: She used a 「kitchen scale」 to measure the flour precisely.
column5: 她使用「厨房秤」来精确地测量面粉。
column6: 典型中式英语：'She use scale for flour.' 纠正：'She used a kitchen scale to measure the flour.'

column1: 一个人在健身房检查自己的体重，记录减肥进展。
column2: 描述使用设备来测量体重，以追踪健康目标的进展。
column3: He stepped on a @ @ to check his weight after the workout.
column4: He stepped on a 「digital scale」 to check his weight after the workout.
column5: 他在锻炼后踩上「电子秤」检查体重。
column6: 典型中式英语：'He stand on scale to see weight.' 纠正：'He stepped on a digital scale to check his weight.'

column1: 一家初创公司获得投资后，计划扩大生产规模以满足市场需求。
column2: 描述业务增长的过程，强调增加生产能力以应对更大需求。
column3: With new funding, the company decided to @ @ its production.
column4: With new funding, the company decided to 「scale up」 its production.
column5: 有了新资金，公司决定「扩大」生产。
column6: 典型中式英语：'Company want to make production bigger.' 纠正：'The company decided to scale up its production.'

column1: 一家餐厅因经济原因减少营业时间，调整运营规模以降低成本。
column2: 描述为了节省资源而缩小业务规模，突出调整的必要性。
column3: Due to financial constraints, the restaurant had to @ @ its hours.
column4: Due to financial constraints, the restaurant had to 「scale down」 its hours.
column5: 由于财务限制，餐厅不得不「缩减」营业时间。
column6: 典型中式英语：'Restaurant make hours less.' 纠正：'The restaurant had to scale down its hours.'

column1: 在一个繁忙的建筑工地上，一名工人不小心从梯子上摔下来，摔伤了腿。
column2: 描述一个人因为意外事故而受到身体上的伤害，通常需要医疗干预。
column3: The worker fell from the ladder and @ @ @.
column4: The worker fell from the ladder and 「sustained an injury」.
column5: 工人从梯子上摔下来「受了伤」。
column6: Chinglish: 'He got hurt a wound.' Correction: 'He sustained an injury.' Explanation: 'Got hurt' is too vague, and 'a wound' is not idiomatic in this context.

column1: 在一场激烈的足球比赛中，一名球员因为对手的粗暴动作而倒地，膝盖受到严重伤害。
column2: 描述在运动中因外力导致的严重身体损伤，通常伴随着疼痛和长期恢复。
column3: The player was @ @ after a harsh tackle.
column4: The player was 「seriously injured」 after a harsh tackle.
column5: 球员在一次粗暴的铲球后「受了重伤」。
column6: Chinglish: 'He was heavy hurt.' Correction: 'He was seriously injured.' Explanation: 'Heavy hurt' is not a natural English expression; 'seriously injured' is the correct collocation.

column1: 在一场公开的新闻发布会上，一名记者错误地指控公司高管贪污，导致高管的名声受损。
column2: 描述通过公开的批评或错误指控对某人社会形象的损害。
column3: The false accusation could @ @ @ in the public eye.
column4: The false accusation could 「injure his reputation」 in the public eye.
column5: 虚假指控可能会在公众眼中「损害他的名誉」。
column6: Chinglish: 'His name was hurt.' Correction: 'His reputation was injured.' Explanation: 'Name' is too literal; 'reputation' is the appropriate term in English.

column1: 在一个朋友聚会上，小明不小心说出了一句批评小红的话，让小红感到非常难过。
column2: 描述因言语或行为导致他人情感上的伤害，通常发生在亲密关系中。
column3: His careless comment might @ @ @.
column4: His careless comment might 「injure her feelings」.
column5: 他不小心的评论可能会「伤害她的感情」。
column6: Chinglish: 'Her heart was hurt.' Correction: 'Her feelings were injured.' Explanation: 'Heart' is overly dramatic and not idiomatic; 'feelings' is more natural.

column1: 在一个寒冷的冬日，火车站台上，一对久别重逢的母女在人群中相认，激动地抱在一起。
column2: 母亲和女儿因为长时间未见，内心充满思念和喜悦，想要通过身体接触表达深厚的感情。
column3: The mother and daughter shared a @ @ after years apart.
column4: The mother and daughter shared a 「warm embrace」 after years apart.
column5: 母亲和女儿在多年分离后分享了一个「温馨的拥抱」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'They hugged warmly.' 纠正：'They shared a warm embrace.'（'hugged warmly' 听起来不够自然，'embrace' 更能传达深情和正式感）

column1: 在一个家庭聚会上，祖父看到刚从国外回来的孙子，高兴地上前紧紧抱住他。
column2: 祖父因为孙子的归来感到欣慰和幸福，希望通过拥抱表达对孙子的爱和支持。
column3: The grandfather gave his grandson a @ @ upon his return.
column4: The grandfather gave his grandson a 「loving embrace」 upon his return.
column5: 祖父在孙子归来时给了他一个「充满爱的拥抱」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'He hugged his grandson with love.' 纠正：'He gave his grandson a loving embrace.'（'hugged with love' 显得生硬，'loving embrace' 更符合英语表达习惯）

column1: 一家传统企业在数字化转型的浪潮中，决定采用新的技术平台来提升效率。
column2: 企业意识到技术的重要性，愿意积极适应新时代的要求，以保持竞争力。
column3: The company decided to @ @ to stay competitive.
column4: The company decided to 「embrace change」 to stay competitive.
column5: 公司决定「接受变革」以保持竞争力。
column6: 典型中式英语：'The company accepted change.' 纠正：'The company embraced change.'（'accepted' 显得被动，'embraced' 更强调主动和热情）

column1: 一位年轻的教师在多元文化的学校工作，主动学习不同文化的特点以更好地与学生沟通。
column2: 教师希望通过接纳不同文化背景，创造一个包容的课堂环境。
column3: The teacher worked to @ @ in her classroom.
column4: The teacher worked to 「embrace diversity」 in her classroom.
column5: 教师致力于在课堂中「接纳多样性」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'She accepted diversity.' 纠正：'She embraced diversity.'（'accepted' 缺乏热情，'embraced' 更能表达主动融入的态度）

column1: 一个国际会议的议程包括科技、环保和经济等多个主题，吸引了不同领域的专家。
column2: 会议希望通过广泛的主题覆盖，吸引更多参与者并促进跨领域交流。
column3: The conference agenda will @ @ @ topics.
column4: The conference agenda will 「embrace a range of」 topics.
column5: 会议议程将「涵盖一系列」主题。
column6: 典型中式英语：'The agenda includes many topics.' 纠正：'The agenda embraces a range of topics.'（'includes' 太平淡，'embraces' 更能突出广泛性和包容性）

column1: 一本书探讨了城市发展的多个维度，包括文化、社会和经济因素。
column2: 作者希望通过全面的分析，让读者理解城市发展的复杂性。
column3: The book aims to @ @ @ urban development.
column4: The book aims to 「embrace various aspects」 of urban development.
column5: 这本书旨在「涵盖城市发展的各个方面」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'The book covers urban development.' 纠正：'The book embraces various aspects of urban development.'（'covers' 缺乏深度，'embraces' 更能体现全面性）

column1: 你在一个咖啡馆和朋友聊天，谈到最近很少看到某个共同的朋友，因为他搬到了另一个城市。
column2: 我想表达我们几乎不怎么见到他，因为他不常出现在我们常去的地方。
column3: Since he moved away, he is @ @ in our usual hangouts.
column4: Since he moved away, he is 「seldom seen」 in our usual hangouts.
column5: 自从他搬走后，他在我们常去的地方「很少被看到」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'We not often see him.' 纠正：'We seldom see him.' 说明：中式英语常忽略频率副词，直接用'not often'，显得不自然；'seldom'更简洁且符合英语习惯。

column1: 你在公司会议上讨论一个老旧的软件工具，提到它现在几乎没人用了，因为有更好的替代品。
column2: 我想说这个工具现在几乎没人用，因为大家都转向了新技术。
column3: With the new technology, this old tool is @ @ by our team.
column4: With the new technology, this old tool is 「seldom used」 by our team.
column5: 有了新技术，这个旧工具在我们团队中「很少被使用」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'This tool is not used often.' 纠正：'This tool is seldom used.' 说明：'not used often'虽然语法正确，但不够地道，'seldom used'更符合英语表达习惯。

column1: 在一个大型音乐厅里，一位年轻的钢琴家正在举办她的首场独奏音乐会，观众们屏息凝神地聆听。
column2: 钢琴家通过精湛的技艺和情感表达，为观众带来了一场难忘的音乐体验。
column3: The young pianist @ @ @ that left the audience in awe.
column4: The young pianist 「delivered a performance」 that left the audience in awe.
column5: 这位年轻的钢琴家「献上了一场演出」，让观众叹为观止。
column6: 典型中式英语：She played a performance very good. 纠正：She 「delivered an outstanding performance」.

column1: 在一个乡村音乐节上，一支乐队在露天舞台上为数千名观众表演，气氛热烈。
column2: 乐队通过充满活力的演出点燃了现场观众的热情。
column3: The band @ @ @ that energized the crowd at the festival.
column4: The band 「gave a performance」 that energized the crowd at the festival.
column5: 这支乐队「进行了一场演出」，点燃了音乐节观众的热情。
column6: 典型中式英语：The band acted a performance. 纠正：The band 「gave a performance」.

column1: 在一家科技公司，经理正在与团队成员进行年度绩效评估，讨论他们的工作成果。
column2: 经理希望通过反馈帮助员工提升他们在工作中的表现。
column3: The manager provided feedback to help the team @ @ @.
column4: The manager provided feedback to help the team 「improve performance」.
column5: 经理提供了反馈，以帮助团队「提升表现」。
column6: 典型中式英语：The manager wants to raise their performance. 纠正：The manager wants to help them 「improve their performance」.

column1: 一位工程师在测试一辆新款电动车的电池续航能力，关注其在长途驾驶中的表现。
column2: 工程师需要评估这款电动车在实际使用中的性能表现。
column3: The engineer conducted tests to @ @ @ of the new electric vehicle.
column4: The engineer conducted tests to 「evaluate performance」 of the new electric vehicle.
column5: 工程师进行了测试，以「评估表现」新款电动车。
column6: 典型中式英语：The engineer checked the performance of the car. 纠正：The engineer 「evaluated the performance」 of the car.

column1: 在一个大型跨国公司中，员工需要遵守严格的保密协议。一名员工不小心将公司机密信息分享给了外部朋友。
column2: 员工的行为破坏了公司对保密的期望，违反了正式的合同条款。
column3: The employee @ @ @ by sharing confidential information with an outsider.
column4: The employee 「violated an agreement」 by sharing confidential information with an outsider.
column5: 该员工通过与外人分享机密信息「违反了协议」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'He broke the contract by telling secrets.' 纠正：'He violated the agreement by sharing confidential information.'（'broke'过于口语化，'violated'更适合正式协议的语境）

column1: 在一个学校里，学生被要求遵守课堂纪律，比如不能在课堂上使用手机。一名学生在考试期间偷偷用手机查答案。
column2: 学生明知规则却故意使用手机，破坏了考试的公平性。
column3: The student @ @ @ by using a phone during the exam.
column4: The student 「violated a rule」 by using a phone during the exam.
column5: 该学生在考试期间使用手机「违反了规则」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'He against the rule to use phone.' 纠正：'He violated the rule by using a phone.'（'against'不用于此语境，'violated'更准确且符合英语习惯）

column1: 在社交媒体时代，某人未经许可将朋友的私人照片发布到网上，引起了朋友的不满。
column2: 未经同意公开私人信息是对他人隐私的不尊重。
column3: Posting private photos without consent @ @ @.
column4: Posting private photos without consent 「violates privacy」.
column5: 未经同意发布私人照片「侵犯了隐私」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'He hurt her privacy by posting photos.' 纠正：'He violated her privacy by posting photos.'（'hurt'不适用于隐私的语境，'violated'更贴切）

column1: 在一个拥挤的咖啡店里，一个人站在另一个陌生人身后太近，让对方感到不舒服。
column2: 过于靠近他人身体的行为被认为是不礼貌的，干扰了对方的舒适感。
column3: Standing too close to someone in a crowded place @ @ @.
column4: Standing too close to someone in a crowded place 「violates personal space」.
column5: 在拥挤的地方站得离别人太近「侵犯了个人空间」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'He entered her private space.' 纠正：'He violated her personal space.'（'entered'不准确，'violated'更能表达对空间的侵犯）

column1: 在一个古老的寺庙中，游客在禁止拍照的区域内强行拍照，引起了当地人的愤怒。
column2: 游客的行为被视为对宗教场所的尊重缺失，破坏了其神圣性。
column3: Taking photos in a restricted temple area @ @ @.
column4: Taking photos in a restricted temple area 「violates a sacred place」.
column5: 在寺庙禁区内拍照「亵渎了神圣场所」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'He damaged the holy place by taking photos.' 纠正：'He violated the sacred place by taking photos.'（'damaged'过于物质化，'violated'更能表达对神圣性的侵犯）

column1: 在一个家庭中，年轻人公开反对家族世代传承的习俗，引发了长辈的不满。
column2: 年轻人的行为被认为是对家族价值观的背叛，伤害了传统的重要性。
column3: Publicly rejecting family customs @ @ @.
column4: Publicly rejecting family customs 「violates a tradition」.
column5: 公开反对家族习俗「亵渎了传统」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'He broke the tradition by rejecting it.' 纠正：'He violated the tradition by rejecting it.'（'broke'过于简单，'violated'更能体现对传统的道德侵犯）

column1: 在一次文化交流活动中，中国学生小李听到外国朋友提到春节，脑海中浮现出家人团聚、吃饺子和放鞭炮的画面。
column2: 小李将春节与温暖的家庭氛围和传统习俗联系在一起，这种联想让他感到亲切。
column3: Whenever I hear about the Spring Festival, I @ @ family gatherings and traditional customs.
column4: Whenever I hear about the Spring Festival, I 「associate it with」 family gatherings and traditional customs.
column5: 每当我听到春节，我就会「把它与」家庭聚会和传统习俗联系起来。
column6: 典型中式英语：I think Spring Festival is family gatherings. 纠正：I associate the Spring Festival with family gatherings, as it evokes those memories.

column1: 小王在公司培训中学习品牌管理，老师提到某些颜色会让人联想到特定的情感，比如红色通常与热情相关。
column2: 小王理解到颜色可以引发情感联想，这种联系影响消费者对品牌的感知。
column3: In branding, the color red is often @ @ passion and energy.
column4: In branding, the color red is often 「associated with」 passion and energy.
column5: 在品牌塑造中，红色通常「与」激情和活力联系在一起。
column6: 典型中式英语：Red means passion in branding. 纠正：Red is associated with passion in branding, as it conveys that emotion.

column1: 小张刚进入一家新公司，同事建议他多与经验丰富的团队成员交流，以建立职业关系。
column2: 小张希望通过与资深同事的交往，学习更多职场经验并扩展人脉。
column3: To grow professionally, I decided to @ @ the senior team members.
column4: To grow professionally, I decided to 「associate with」 the senior team members.
column5: 为了职业发展，我决定「与」资深团队成员交往。
column6: 典型中式英语：I want to make friends with senior members. 纠正：I want to associate with senior members to build professional connections.

column1: 在一次创业活动中，小李认识了一位志同道合的伙伴，决定一起合作开发一个新项目。
column2: 小李希望通过与这位伙伴的合作，共同实现创业梦想。
column3: I’m excited to @ @ a talented entrepreneur on this project.
column4: I’m excited to 「associate myself with」 a talented entrepreneur on this project.
column5: 我很兴奋能「与」一位才华横溢的创业者在这个项目上合作。
column6: 典型中式英语：I work together with an entrepreneur. 纠正：I’m thrilled to associate myself with an entrepreneur for this collaboration.

column1: 在一次商务会议中，公司老板介绍了一位长期合作的商业伙伴，称其为重要业务联系人。
column2: 这位商业伙伴在公司业务中扮演重要角色，是值得信赖的合作者。
column3: Our CEO introduced her @ @ as a key partner in our expansion.
column4: Our CEO introduced her 「business associate」 as a key partner in our expansion.
column5: 我们的CEO介绍了她的「商业伙伴」，称其是我们扩张中的关键合作伙伴。
column6: 典型中式英语：She is our business friend. 纠正：She is our business associate, a key collaborator in our projects.

column1: 小赵在一家咨询公司工作，他的导师是一位经验丰富的顾问，被称为公司的重要成员。
column2: 小赵的导师在公司中地位重要，是他学习和职业发展的榜样。
column3: My mentor, a @ @ the firm, has guided me through complex projects.
column4: My mentor, a 「close associate of」 the firm, has guided me through complex projects.
column5: 我的导师，公司的一个「亲密伙伴」，指导我完成了复杂的项目。
column6: 典型中式英语：My mentor is a friend of the company. 纠正：My mentor is a close associate of the company, highly valued for their expertise.

column1: 小明在家里有一个自己的小房间，每次他想要安静地读书或思考时，他都会关上门，告诉家人不要进来打扰。
column2: 小明希望在自己的空间里不被打扰，享受独处的时光，家人应该理解并尊重他的需求。
column3: His family always tries to @ @ @ when he’s in his room.
column4: His family always tries to 「respect his privacy」 when he’s in his room.
column5: 他的家人总是尽量「尊重他的个人空间」当他在房间里时。
column6: 典型中式英语：'His family don’t disturb his private.' 纠正：'His family respect his privacy.'（避免用'private'作名词，'disturb'显得过于直接，改为更自然的'respect'搭配。）

column1: 小红在咖啡馆里戴着耳机写日记，她选择了一个角落的位置，希望没有人会偷看她的笔记本。
column2: 小红想要在公共场所也能保持自己的私人空间，避免别人窥探她的私人内容。
column3: She felt annoyed when someone’s staring was an @ @ @.
column4: She felt annoyed when someone’s staring was an 「invasion of privacy」.
column5: 她感到恼火，因为别人的注视是一种「侵犯个人空间」的行为。
column6: 典型中式英语：'Someone look at her diary is not polite.' 纠正：'Someone staring at her diary is an invasion of privacy.'（'not polite'表达过于模糊，'invasion of privacy'更准确且地道。）

column1: 小刚在网上购物时，总是小心检查网站是否安全，因为他担心自己的银行卡信息会被泄露。
column2: 小刚希望确保自己的个人信息在网络上不被窃取，采取措施保护数据安全。
column3: He uses a VPN to @ @ @ when shopping online.
column4: He uses a VPN to 「protect his privacy」 when shopping online.
column5: 他使用VPN来「保护他的个人信息」在网上购物时。
column6: 典型中式英语：'He wants to keep his information safe.' 纠正：'He wants to protect his privacy.'（'keep safe'不够具体，'protect your privacy'是更自然的表达。）

column1: 小丽发现一个她常用的社交媒体平台泄露了用户数据，她非常担心自己的照片和聊天记录被公开。
column2: 小丽对自己的个人信息被滥用感到不安，觉得平台应该对数据泄露负责。
column3: The data leak was considered a serious @ @ @ by the users.
column4: The data leak was considered a serious 「breach of privacy」 by the users.
column5: 数据泄露被用户认为是一次严重的「侵犯个人信息」行为。
column6: 典型中式英语：'The leak makes users’ information not safe.' 纠正：'The leak is a breach of privacy.'（'not safe'表达模糊，'breach of privacy'更符合语境且专业。）

column1: 在家庭聚会上，大家围坐在餐桌旁，边吃边聊。突然一位亲戚因为吃得太快，食物卡在喉咙里，脸色发红，咳嗽不止。
column2: 描述某人因为吃东西太急，导致食物堵住喉咙，出现呼吸困难的情况。
column3: He started to @ @ @ when a piece of bread got stuck in his throat.
column4: He started to 「choke on food」 when a piece of bread got stuck in his throat.
column5: 他因为一块面包卡在喉咙里开始「被食物噎住」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'He was choked by food.' 纠正：'He choked on food.'（中式英语常误用被动语态，正确表达是用主动语态搭配介词'on'。）

column1: 在一次紧张的演讲中，讲者因为情绪激动，眼泪几乎夺眶而出，但他努力控制住，不让泪水流下来。
column2: 描述某人因强烈的情感而想哭，但强行忍住泪水的情况。
column3: She had to @ @ @ during her speech to stay composed.
column4: She had to 「choke back tears」 during her speech to stay composed.
column5: 她在演讲中不得不「强忍泪水」以保持镇定。
column6: 典型中式英语：'She held her tears.' 纠正：'She choked back tears.'（中式英语常直接翻译为'hold tears'，但英语中常用'choke back'表达强忍情感。）

column1: 在一场重要的篮球比赛中，队伍在最后几秒领先，主力队员站在罚球线上，但由于全场观众的注视，他紧张得手抖，罚球没进。
column2: 描述运动员在关键时刻因为紧张而未能发挥正常水平。
column3: He always @ @ @ when the game is on the line.
column4: He always 「chokes under pressure」 when the game is on the line.
column5: 他在比赛关键时刻总是「因压力失常」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'He failed because of nervous.' 纠正：'He choked under pressure.'（中式英语常直接用'fail'或'nervous'，而'choke'更生动地表达因紧张失误。）

column1: 在一场全国性的演讲比赛中，一位选手在决赛中表现得非常出色，但到了最后的关键问题环节，她突然忘了准备的内容，愣在台上。
column2: 描述某人在重要场合因紧张而头脑一片空白，未能完成任务。
column3: She @ @ @ during the final round of the contest.
column4: She 「choked at the last moment」 during the final round of the contest.
column5: 她在比赛的最后关头「关键时刻失常」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'She was too nervous to finish.' 纠正：'She choked at the last moment.'（中式英语常泛泛描述紧张，'choke'更精准地表达关键时刻的失误。）

column1: 在一场暴雨过后，城市的排水系统因为树叶和垃圾堆积而无法正常工作，导致街道积水严重。
column2: 描述管道或系统因杂物堆积而被堵塞，影响正常功能。
column3: Leaves and trash @ @ @ after the storm, causing floods.
column4: Leaves and trash 「choked a drain」 after the storm, causing floods.
column5: 暴风雨后树叶和垃圾「堵塞了下水道」，导致洪水。
column6: 典型中式英语：'The drain was blocked by leaves.' 纠正：'Leaves choked a drain.'（中式英语常用'block'，但'choke'更形象地描述管道堵塞。）

column1: 在一个繁忙的节假日，市中心的道路挤满了车辆和游客，交通几乎瘫痪。
column2: 描述道路因人流或车流过多而被堵塞，交通受阻。
column3: Tourists and cars @ @ @ during the holiday season.
column4: Tourists and cars 「choked the streets」 during the holiday season.
column5: 游客和车辆在节假日期间「堵塞了街道」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'The streets were full of cars.' 纠正：'The streets were choked with cars.'（中式英语常简单描述'full'，'choke'更生动地表达拥堵。）

column1: 在公司会议中，团队正在讨论如何提高产品销量，经理提出了一个新的营销策略，但有人觉得成本太高，需要其他方案。
column2: 提出一个不同的方法来解决问题，以降低成本或提高效率。
column3: We need to consider an @ @ to reduce expenses while maintaining quality.
column4: We need to consider an 「alternative approach」 to reduce expenses while maintaining quality.
column5: 我们需要考虑一种「替代方法」来降低成本，同时保持质量。
column6: 典型中式英语：'We need a different way for reduce cost.' 纠正：'We need an alternative approach to reduce costs.'（注意冠词、搭配和名词复数）

column1: 在学校小组作业中，学生们计划去图书馆查找资料，但因为时间有限，有人建议换个方式完成研究。
column2: 换一种更高效的途径来完成任务，而不是坚持原来的计划。
column3: Since time is limited, let’s try an @ @ to gather information quickly.
column4: Since time is limited, let’s try an 「alternative solution」 to gather information quickly.
column5: 由于时间有限，我们尝试一种「替代方案」来快速收集信息。
column6: 典型中式英语：'Let’s find another method to do it fast.' 纠正：'Let’s try an alternative solution to do it quickly.'（注意搭配和副词用法）

column1: 一个年轻人向朋友介绍自己独特的生活方式，比如不住在城市，而是选择在乡村自给自足。
column2: 展示一种与主流不同的生活方式，强调个性化和独特性。
column3: She’s embraced an @ @ by living off the grid in a rural area.
column4: She’s embraced an 「alternative lifestyle」 by living off the grid in a rural area.
column5: 她通过在农村过离网生活，选择了「另类生活方式」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'She lives a different life in countryside.' 纠正：'She embraces an alternative lifestyle in the countryside.'（注意搭配和动词选择）

column1: 在讨论环保问题时，老师向学生介绍一些非化石燃料的能源，比如太阳能和风能。
column2: 强调使用非传统能源来保护环境，突出可持续性。
column3: We should invest in @ @ to reduce our reliance on fossil fuels.
column4: We should invest in 「alternative energy」 to reduce our reliance on fossil fuels.
column5: 我们应该投资「替代能源」，以减少对化石燃料的依赖。
column6: 典型中式英语：'We need new energy for less pollution.' 纠正：'We need alternative energy to reduce pollution.'（注意搭配和表达精确性）

column1: 一个年轻人在大学社团活动中，向同学们介绍自己热衷的环保事业，试图激励大家加入。
column2: 他想要表达自己对环保的极大热情，并希望感染他人。
column3: She @ @ @ environmental conservation and inspires others to join her cause.
column4: She 「is passionate about」 environmental conservation and inspires others to join her cause.
column5: 她「对环境保护充满热情」，激励他人加入她的事业。
column6: 典型中式英语：'She very love environment protection.' 纠正：'She is passionate about environmental conservation.'

column1: 一位政治家在竞选活动中发表演说，试图用充满感染力的语言打动选民。
column2: 他希望通过演讲展现自己的信念和热情，赢得支持。
column3: His @ @ moved the audience and gained their support.
column4: His 「passionate speech」 moved the audience and gained their support.
column5: 他的「充满激情的演讲」打动了观众，赢得了他们的支持。
column6: 典型中式英语：'His speech very exciting.' 纠正：'His passionate speech moved the audience.'

column1: 在一部浪漫电影中，男女主角在雨中重逢，深情地表达彼此的爱意。
column2: 他们通过一个深情的动作表达浓烈的爱。
column3: They shared a @ @ in the pouring rain, oblivious to the world around them.
column4: They shared a 「passionate kiss」 in the pouring rain, oblivious to the world around them.
column5: 他们在倾盆大雨中分享了一个「充满激情的吻」，完全忘记了周围的世界。
column6: 典型中式英语：'They kiss very strong.' 纠正：'They shared a passionate kiss.'

column1: 一对恋人在纪念日庆祝时，回忆起他们刚开始恋爱时的甜蜜时光。
column2: 他们想要表达那段感情的强烈和浪漫。
column3: Their @ @ @ began with late-night talks and endless adventures.
column4: Their 「passionate love affair」 began with late-night talks and endless adventures.
column5: 他们的「充满激情的恋情」始于深夜的交谈和无尽的冒险。
column6: 典型中式英语：'Their love very hot.' 纠正：'Their passionate love affair began with late-night talks.'

column1: 在公司会议中，经理需要分配一个重要项目，团队中有一位员工因其出色的组织能力和专业知识而被选中。
column2: 这位员工被认为有足够的能力独立完成复杂的项目，经理对他充满信心。
column3: We trust her to lead the project because she is @ @ @ it successfully.
column4: We trust her to lead the project because she is 「capable of doing」 it successfully.
column5: 我们相信她能领导这个项目，因为她「有能力完成」它。
column6: 典型中式英语：She is very able to do this project. 纠正：She is capable of doing this project successfully.

column1: 在学校里，老师注意到一名学生在数学竞赛中表现出色，能够解决高难度的题目。
column2: 这名学生展现了很强的数学能力，老师认为他有潜力在学术领域取得更大成就。
column3: The student proved to be @ @ in solving complex problems.
column4: The student proved to be 「highly capable」 in solving complex problems.
column5: 这名学生在解决复杂问题时证明自己「非常有能力」。
column6: 典型中式英语：He is very strong in math. 纠正：He is highly capable in math.

column1: 一家科技公司推出了一款新型无人机，宣传其能够在极端天气下执行任务。
column2: 这款无人机被设计得非常先进，可以应对各种挑战，吸引了客户的关注。
column3: This drone is @ @ @ tasks in harsh conditions.
column4: This drone is 「capable of handling」 tasks in harsh conditions.
column5: 这款无人机「能够处理」恶劣条件下的任务。
column6: 典型中式英语：This drone can do tasks in bad weather. 纠正：This drone is capable of handling tasks in harsh conditions.

column1: 在医院里，医生使用一台新引进的医疗设备，能够更精准地诊断疾病。
column2: 这台设备功能强大，可以显著提高诊断的准确性，让医生对治疗更有信心。
column3: The new machine is @ @ @ more accurate results.
column4: The new machine is 「capable of achieving」 more accurate results.
column5: 这台新机器「能够实现」更精确的结果。
column6: 典型中式英语：This machine can make better results. 纠正：This machine is capable of achieving more accurate results.

column1: 在一场时尚展览中，观众被一款新设计的服装吸引，纷纷驻足观看。
column2: 这款服装的设计独特，让人觉得很吸引，想多看几眼。
column3: The new clothing line @ @ to a wide audience due to its unique design.
column4: The new clothing line 「has appeal」 to a wide audience due to its unique design.
column5: 这条新服装系列因其独特的设计对广大观众「很有吸引力」。
column6: 典型中式英语：This clothing is very attracting. 纠正：This clothing has great appeal.

column1: 一部新上映的电影因其幽默和感人的剧情，吸引了各个年龄段的观众。
column2: 这部电影的剧情很抓人，适合很多人看。
column3: The movie’s storyline has @ @, drawing crowds of all ages.
column4: The movie’s storyline has 「broad appeal」, drawing crowds of all ages.
column5: 这部电影的故事情节「广泛吸引」，吸引了各个年龄段的观众。
column6: 典型中式英语：This movie attracts many people. 纠正：This movie has broad appeal.

column1: 一名被告对地方法院的判决不服，决定向更高一级法院提出上诉。
column2: 被告觉得判决不公平，想通过法律程序争取改判。
column3: The defendant decided to @ @ @ against the court’s ruling.
column4: The defendant decided to 「file an appeal」 against the court’s ruling.
column5: 被告决定对法院的裁决「提起上诉」。
column6: 典型中式英语：The defendant wants to appeal the case. 纠正：The defendant decided to file an appeal.

column1: 一名律师成功帮助客户在上诉中获胜，推翻了原判。
column2: 律师通过努力让客户在上诉中赢得了胜利。
column3: The lawyer helped the client @ @ @, overturning the original verdict.
column4: The lawyer helped the client 「win an appeal」, overturning the original verdict.
column5: 律师帮助客户「赢得上诉」，推翻了原判。
column6: 典型中式英语：The lawyer made the client win the appeal case. 纠正：The lawyer helped the client win an appeal.

column1: 在一场自然灾害后，当地政府向全国发出救援请求。
column2: 政府希望通过呼吁让更多人参与救援工作。
column3: The local government @ @ @ for nationwide support after the disaster.
column4: The local government 「made an appeal」 for nationwide support after the disaster.
column5: 当地政府对全国「发出呼吁」，请求支持灾后救援。
column6: 典型中式英语：The government appealed for help. 纠正：The government made an appeal for help.

column1: 一家慈善机构在电视上公开请求公众为贫困儿童捐款。
column2: 慈善机构希望通过公开呼吁感动大家，捐款帮助孩子。
column3: The charity launched a @ @ to raise funds for underprivileged children.
column4: The charity launched a 「public appeal」 to raise funds for underprivileged children.
column5: 该慈善机构发起了一场「公开呼吁」，为贫困儿童筹集资金。
column6: 典型中式英语：The charity asked for public donation. 纠正：The charity launched a public appeal for donations.

column1: 一个学生在考试中因为没有仔细检查答案，导致丢分。
column2: 学生因为粗心，在试卷上犯了一些本可以避免的错误。
column3: She lost marks due to a @ @ she made in the exam.
column4: She lost marks due to a 「careless mistake」 she made in the exam.
column5: 她因为在考试中犯了一个「粗心的错误」而丢了分。
column6: 典型中式英语：'She because not careful so made mistake.' 纠正：'She made a mistake because she was careless.'

column1: 一个司机在开车时因为分心，差点撞到前面的车。
column2: 司机没有专心开车，导致危险的行为。
column3: His @ @ nearly caused an accident on the highway.
column4: His 「careless driving」 nearly caused an accident on the highway.
column5: 他的「粗心驾驶」差点在高速公路上引发事故。
column6: 典型中式英语：'He drive not careful so almost accident.' 纠正：'His careless driving almost caused an accident.'

column1: 一个员工在会议中对项目提出不负责任的评论，显得不够重视。
column2: 员工对工作表现出一种不认真的态度，让同事感到失望。
column3: His @ @ during the meeting upset his colleagues.
column4: His 「careless remark」 during the meeting upset his colleagues.
column5: 他在会议上的「漫不经心的评论」让同事们感到不安。
column6: 典型中式英语：'He say something not serious in meeting.' 纠正：'His careless remark in the meeting was inappropriate.'

column1: 一个学生在团队项目中敷衍了事，导致整个小组表现不佳。
column2: 学生对团队任务不投入，态度显得随便。
column3: The team failed because of her @ @ to the project.
column4: The team failed because of her 「careless approach」 to the project.
column5: 团队因为她对项目的「漫不经心的态度」而失败了。
column6: 典型中式英语：'She not serious to project so team fail.' 纠正：'Her careless approach to the project led to the team’s failure.'

column1: 在一个阳光明媚的下午，小明和朋友们在公园里玩棒球。轮到他挥棒时，他全神贯注，准备打出一个漂亮的球。
column2: 小明想要用力挥棒，让球飞得很远，赢得队友的欢呼。
column3: He swung the bat and @ @ @ with all his strength.
column4: He swung the bat and 「hit the ball」 with all his strength.
column5: 他挥动球棒，用尽全力「打中了球」。
column6: 典型中式英语：He beat the ball very hard. 纠正：He hit the ball with great force.（‘beat’通常用于连续打击或击败，而‘hit’更适合描述单次快速撞击。）

column1: 在射击训练场上，小红第一次尝试射箭。她调整姿势，瞄准远处的靶子，希望能射中。
column2: 小红希望自己的箭能准确地射中靶心，证明自己的能力。
column3: She aimed carefully and @ @ @ perfectly.
column4: She aimed carefully and 「hit the target」 perfectly.
column5: 她仔细瞄准，完美地「射中了靶子」。
column6: 典型中式英语：She shooted the target. 纠正：She hit the target.（‘shoot’指开枪或射箭的动作，而‘hit’强调箭或子弹实际命中目标。）

column1: 小李的公司刚刚推出一款新产品，经过一个月的销售，他们终于达到了预期的销售目标。
column2: 小李希望公司的努力得到回报，产品销量达到一个重要的节点。
column3: After a month of sales, the company finally @ @ @.
column4: After a month of sales, the company finally 「hit a milestone」.
column5: 经过一个月的销售，公司终于「达到了一个里程碑」。
column6: 典型中式英语：The company arrived a milestone. 纠正：The company hit a milestone.（‘arrive’通常指到达地点，而‘hit’更适合表示达到抽象目标。）

column1: 一个视频博主小王发布了一段搞笑视频，几天后他发现视频的浏览量突破了预期。
column2: 小王希望自己的视频能吸引大量观众，达到一个令人兴奋的观看记录。
column3: His video went viral and @ @ @ within days.
column4: His video went viral and 「hit a record」 within days.
column5: 他的视频迅速走红，几天内「创下了记录」。
column6: 典型中式英语：His video reached a record. 纠正：His video hit a record.（‘reach’更通用，但‘hit’在记录或数字突破时更生动、自然。）

column1: 小张在公司头脑风暴会议上苦思冥想如何解决产品问题，突然灵感涌现，想到了一个创新的点子。
column2: 小张希望能提出一个独特的主意，让团队眼前一亮。
column3: While brainstorming, he suddenly @ @ @ that could solve the issue.
column4: While brainstorming, he suddenly 「hit on an idea」 that could solve the issue.
column5: 在头脑风暴时，他突然「想到了一个主意」，可以解决这个问题。
column6: 典型中式英语：He thought an idea suddenly. 纠正：He hit on an idea suddenly.（‘think’过于宽泛，‘hit on’更精准地表达突然想到的灵感。）

column1: 小美在和朋友聊天时，突然意识到自己忘记了重要的考试日期，吓了一跳。
column2: 小美希望自己能及时记起重要的事情，但突然意识到时有点慌张。
column3: While chatting, @ @ @ that she forgot about the exam.
column4: While chatting, 「it hit me」 that she forgot about the exam.
column5: 在聊天时，「我突然意识到」她忘记了考试。
column6: 典型中式英语：I suddenly know I forgot the exam. 纠正：It hit me that I forgot the exam.（‘know’表示已知的事实，而‘it hit me’更适合描述突然的顿悟。）

column1: 一个新乐队发布了自己的首张专辑，主打歌迅速登上音乐排行榜，受到粉丝热捧。
column2: 乐队希望自己的音乐能引起共鸣，成为广受欢迎的歌曲。
column3: Their new single became a @ @ within weeks.
column4: Their new single became a 「hit song」 within weeks.
column5: 他们的新单曲在几周内成为一首「热门歌曲」。
column6: 典型中式英语：Their song became very famous. 纠正：Their song became a hit.（‘famous’过于笼统，‘hit’更精确地表示流行成功。）

column1: 一部新上映的喜剧电影吸引了大量观众，票房一路飙升，成为暑期档的亮点。
column2: 电影团队希望影片能大获成功，吸引观众并赚得高票房。
column3: The comedy was a @ @ at the box office.
column4: The comedy was a 「big hit」 at the box office.
column5: 这部喜剧在票房上是一个「巨大成功」。
column6: 典型中式英语：The movie was very popular in box office. 纠正：The movie was a big hit at the box office.（‘popular’不够具体，‘big hit’更适合描述商业成功。）

column1: 一个人在医院里，医生要求他服用一颗药丸。他有些紧张，因为药丸看起来很大，但他还是努力尝试。
column2: 他需要用力把药丸咽下去，尽管有点困难。
column3: He took a deep breath and tried to @ @ @ with a glass of water.
column4: He took a deep breath and tried to 「swallow a pill」 with a glass of water.
column5: 他深吸一口气，试图用一杯水「吞下一颗药丸」。
column6: 中式英语：'He eat the pill with water.' 纠正：'He swallowed the pill with water.'（中文里常说'吃药'，但英文中用'swallow'描述吞咽药丸的动作。）

column1: 在家庭聚餐中，一个人因为吃得太快，食物卡在喉咙里，他需要喝点水来帮助咽下去。
column2: 他需要把食物咽下去以继续吃饭。
column3: He grabbed a glass of water to help @ @ @ stuck in his throat.
column4: He grabbed a glass of water to help 「swallow food」 stuck in his throat.
column5: 他拿了一杯水来帮助「吞咽食物」，因为食物卡在喉咙里。
column6: 中式英语：'He drink water to eat food.' 纠正：'He drank water to swallow the food.'（中文常说'吃'食物，但英文中用'swallow'描述咽下食物的动作。）

column1: 在一个春天的早晨，一个人站在乡村的田野边，观察天空中的鸟儿。他注意到一群燕子在空中飞翔。
column2: 他被燕子优雅的飞行姿态所吸引。
column3: He stood in the field, watching the graceful @ @ @ against the clear sky.
column4: He stood in the field, watching the graceful 「swallow in flight」 against the clear sky.
column5: 他站在田野里，观察着晴朗天空下优雅的「飞翔的燕子」。
column6: 中式英语：'He look at the swallow fly.' 纠正：'He watched the swallow in flight.'（中文常直接说'燕子飞'，但英文中用'in flight'描述飞翔的状态更自然。）

column1: 在乡下的老房子里，一个人发现屋檐下有一个燕子巢，里面有几只小燕子。
column2: 他惊讶于燕子在屋檐下筑巢的精巧。
column3: Under the eaves, he found a carefully built @ @ @ with tiny chicks inside.
column4: Under the eaves, he found a carefully built 「swallow nests」 with tiny chicks inside.
column5: 在屋檐下，他发现了一个精心搭建的「燕子巢」，里面有几只小雏鸟。
column6: 中式英语：'He see swallow house.' 纠正：'He saw swallow nests.'（中文常说'燕子窝'，但英文中用'nests'更准确，且无需'house'。）

column1: 在一次工作冲突后，一个人意识到自己需要放下自尊，向同事道歉以解决问题。
column2: 他必须放下自尊以修复关系。
column3: To resolve the conflict, he had to @ @ @ and apologize to his colleague.
column4: To resolve the conflict, he had to 「swallow one’s pride」 and apologize to his colleague.
column5: 为了解决冲突，他不得不「咽下自尊」，向同事道歉。
column6: 中式英语：'He eat his pride.' 纠正：'He swallowed his pride.'（中文说'咽下自尊'，但英文中用'swallow one’s pride'是固定表达。）

column1: 一个人得知一个令人震惊的事实，比如朋友的背叛，他需要时间来接受这个现实。
column2: 他需要努力接受这个残酷的事实。
column3: It took him days to @ @ @ that his friend had betrayed him.
column4: It took him days to 「swallow the truth」 that his friend had betrayed him.
column5: 他花了几天时间才「接受真相」，即他的朋友背叛了他。
column6: 中式英语：'He accept truth hard.' 纠正：'He swallowed the truth.'（中文常说'接受'，但'swallow the truth'更能表达艰难接受的过程。）

column1: 小明最近身体不适，经常感到疲倦和头痛。他决定去医院检查，以确保没有严重问题。
column2: 小明想找一个专业的医生来了解自己的健康状况，并得到治疗建议。
column3: After feeling unwell for weeks, he decided to @ @ @ for advice.
column4: After feeling unwell for weeks, he decided to 「consult a doctor」 for advice.
column5: 在感到不适几周后，他决定「咨询医生」以获得建议。
column6: 典型中式英语：'He went to see a doctor to ask his health.' 纠正：'He consulted a doctor about his health.'（'ask his health' 不符合英语表达习惯，改为 consult 表示正式寻求建议。）

column1: 公司正在开发一个新产品，但团队在技术方案上意见不一，项目经理建议找业内权威人士提供指导。
column2: 项目经理希望通过与专业人士交流，找到最优的技术解决方案。
column3: To resolve the technical debate, the manager arranged to @ @ @.
column4: To resolve the technical debate, the manager arranged to 「consult an expert」.
column5: 为了解决技术争议，经理安排「咨询专家」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'The manager asked an expert for technical problems.' 纠正：'The manager consulted an expert on technical issues.'（'ask for technical problems' 表达不自然，consult on 表示针对某问题咨询。）

column1: 小红在写英语作文时，遇到一个不确定的单词，想确认它的拼写和用法。
column2: 小红希望通过查字典来确保用词准确，避免错误。
column3: Unsure about the word’s spelling, she decided to @ @ @.
column4: Unsure about the word’s spelling, she decided to 「consult a dictionary」.
column5: 不确定单词的拼写，她决定「查阅字典」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'She looked the dictionary for the word.' 纠正：'She consulted a dictionary for the word.'（'look the dictionary' 不正确，consult 或 look up 是查阅的正确表达。）

column1: 张伟和朋友计划一次自驾游，但对路线不熟悉，他决定查看地图以确定最佳路径。
column2: 张伟想通过查看地图来规划行程，确保旅途顺利。
column3: To plan the road trip, he needed to @ @ @ for directions.
column4: To plan the road trip, he needed to 「consult a map」 for directions.
column5: 为了规划自驾游，他需要「查阅地图」以确定方向。
column6: 典型中式英语：'He checked the map to find the way.' 纠正：'He consulted a map to find the route.'（'find the way' 略显口语化，consult a map 和 route 更正式且符合语境。）

column1: 一位环保主义者在一次社区会议上向居民讲解保护当地湿地的重要性，强调生态平衡。
column2: 通过行动确保湿地生态系统不被破坏，维持其自然状态以支持动植物生存。
column3: Her speech focused on the urgent need for @ @ to protect the local wetlands.
column4: Her speech focused on the urgent need for 「environmental preservation」 to protect the local wetlands.
column5: 她的演讲强调了对当地湿地进行「环境保护」的迫切需要。
column6: 典型中式英语：'We must protect environment.' 纠正：'We must prioritize environmental preservation.'

column1: 一个非政府组织在非洲发起了一项保护濒危动物的项目，吸引了国际关注。
column2: 通过建立保护区和制定法律来确保珍稀动物种群的生存和繁衍。
column3: The organization launched a campaign to promote @ @ in the region.
column4: The organization launched a campaign to promote 「wildlife preservation」 in the region.
column5: 该组织发起了一项运动，以促进该地区的「野生动物保护」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'Save wild animals.' 纠正：'Support wildlife preservation efforts.'

column1: 一位家庭主妇在秋季丰收后，将自家果园的水果制成果酱以便长期储存。
column2: 通过加工水果来延长其食用时间，避免浪费。
column3: She spent the weekend learning about @ @ to make homemade jams.
column4: She spent the weekend learning about 「food preservation」 to make homemade jams.
column5: 她花了周末时间学习「食品保存」以制作自制果酱。
column6: 典型中式英语：'Keep food fresh.' 纠正：'Use food preservation techniques.'

column1: 一家食品公司在研发新的冷冻技术，以确保产品在运输过程中保持品质。
column2: 通过先进的冷冻方法来维持食品的新鲜度和营养价值。
column3: The company invested heavily in new @ @ to improve product quality.
column4: The company invested heavily in new 「preservation techniques」 to improve product quality.
column5: 该公司大力投资于新的「保存技术」以提高产品质量。
column6: 典型中式英语：'Make food last long.' 纠正：'Adopt advanced preservation techniques.'

column1: 在一个繁忙的火车站，你和朋友需要保持一定的空间以避免拥挤，同时还能继续交谈。
column2: 为了避免过于拥挤，你会选择与朋友稍微分开一些，但仍然能看到彼此。
column3: To avoid the crowd, we decided to @ @ @ from each other while still talking.
column4: To avoid the crowd, we decided to 「keep a distance」 from each other while still talking.
column5: 为了避免拥挤，我们决定「保持距离」但仍然继续交谈。
column6: 典型中式英语：'We stay far to talk.' 纠正：'We keep a distance to continue talking.'

column1: 你和朋友计划去附近的一家咖啡店，步行只需要几分钟。
column2: 咖啡店很近，步行过去很方便，不需要开车或乘坐公共交通。
column3: The café is just a @ @ away, so we can walk there.
column4: The café is just a 「short distance」 away, so we can walk there.
column5: 咖啡店只有「很短的距离」，所以我们可以步行过去。
column6: 典型中式英语：'The café is very near distance.' 纠正：'The café is a short distance away.'

column1: 你和一位老朋友因为长期没有联系，感觉彼此的关系变得有些陌生。
column2: 虽然你们曾经很亲密，但现在因为缺乏沟通，关系变得疏远了。
column3: After years of no contact, I began to @ @ @ from my old friend.
column4: After years of no contact, I began to 「feel a distance」 from my old friend.
column5: 多年没有联系后，我开始「感到疏远」我的老朋友。
column6: 典型中式英语：'I feel far with my friend.' 纠正：'I feel a distance from my friend.'

column1: 在工作中，你和一位同事因为意见不合，刻意减少了交流。
column2: 为了避免冲突，你选择与同事保持一定的心理界限，减少不必要的互动。
column3: To avoid arguments, she decided to @ @ between herself and her colleague.
column4: To avoid arguments, she decided to 「create distance」 between herself and her colleague.
column5: 为了避免争吵，她决定在自己和同事之间「制造距离」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'She wants to far from her colleague.' 纠正：'She wants to create distance from her colleague.'

column1: 你在回忆童年时，感觉那些日子已经过去了很久。
column2: 童年的记忆虽然清晰，但感觉已经离现在很远了。
column3: My childhood feels like it happened @ @ @ years.
column4: My childhood feels like it happened 「at a distance of」 years.
column5: 我的童年感觉像是「相隔多年」的事情。
column6: 典型中式英语：'My childhood is far years.' 纠正：'My childhood feels at a distance of years.'

column1: 你在计划一次旅行，确保行程安排之间有足够的时间缓冲。
column2: 为了避免行程过于紧张，你会在活动之间留出一些时间间隔。
column3: We scheduled the meetings at a @ @ @ @ to avoid rushing.
column4: We scheduled the meetings at a 「safe distance in time」 to avoid rushing.
column5: 我们将会议安排在「安全的时间间隔」内，以避免匆忙。
column6: 典型中式英语：'We put meetings with time far.' 纠正：'We scheduled meetings at a safe distance in time.'

column1: 在超市购物时，顾客通常需要决定是否使用商店提供的袋子来装购买的商品。
column2: 我想表达超市里用来装东西的袋子是用一种轻便材料做的。
column3: At the supermarket, I put my groceries in a @ @.
column4: At the supermarket, I put my groceries in a 「plastic bag」.
column5: 在超市，我把买的杂货放进一个「塑料袋」里。
column6: 典型中式英语：'I put my things in a plastic.' 纠正：'Plastic' 单独使用不指代袋子，应说 'plastic bag' 或 'bag made of plastic'。

column1: 在户外野餐时，人们通常会带一些便携的容器来装食物。
column2: 我想说野餐时用来装沙拉的容器是轻便且不易碎的。
column3: For the picnic, we packed the salad in a @ @.
column4: For the picnic, we packed the salad in a 「plastic container」.
column5: 为了野餐，我们把沙拉装在一个「塑料容器」里。
column6: 典型中式英语：'We use a plastic to hold food.' 纠正：'Plastic' 需具体化，应说 'plastic container' 或 'container made of plastic'。

column1: 在社交媒体上，人们讨论某位名人看起来焕然一新，可能是因为外貌上的变化。
column2: 我想表达某人通过手术改变了自己的外貌。
column3: The celebrity’s new look is likely due to @ @.
column4: The celebrity’s new look is likely due to 「plastic surgery」.
column5: 这位名人的新面貌很可能是因为「整形手术」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'She did plastic to her face.' 纠正：'Plastic' 不能单独用，应说 'plastic surgery'。

column1: 在一个正式的社交场合，有人注意到某人的笑容看起来不太真诚。
column2: 我想说某人的笑容看起来很假，像是在强颜欢笑。
column3: Her @ @ made it clear she wasn’t genuinely happy.
column4: Her 「plastic smile」 made it clear she wasn’t genuinely happy.
column5: 她「假笑」清楚地表明她并不真正开心。
column6: 典型中式英语：'She has a plastic face.' 纠正：'Plastic face' 不常用，应说 'plastic smile' 来形容虚假的笑容。

column1: 在商场购物时，收银员询问顾客的支付方式。
column2: 我想说顾客选择用信用卡来支付购买的商品。
column3: At the checkout, I decided to @ @ @.
column4: At the checkout, I decided to 「pay with plastic」.
column5: 在结账时，我决定「用信用卡支付」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'I use plastic money.' 纠正：'Plastic money' 不常用，应说 'pay with plastic' 或 'use a credit card'。

column1: 在咖啡店，朋友们讨论谁来付账单。
column2: 我想说某人主动拿出信用卡来支付大家的咖啡。
column3: Don’t worry, I’ll @ @ for everyone’s coffee.
column4: Don’t worry, I’ll 「use plastic」 for everyone’s coffee.
column5: 别担心，我会「用信用卡」支付大家的咖啡。
column6: 典型中式英语：'I pay with plastic card.' 纠正：'Plastic card' 冗余，应说 'use plastic' 或 'pay with a credit card'。

column1: 一个家庭计划周末去郊游，妈妈在周五晚上打开电视，观看天气预报，想知道是否需要带伞。
column2: 妈妈想知道明天会不会下雨，以便决定是否取消郊游计划。
column3: The meteorologist on TV said it’s hard to @ @ @ accurately with the current data.
column4: The meteorologist on TV said it’s hard to 「predict the future」 accurately with the current data.
column5: 电视上的气象学家说，根据现在的数据很难准确「预测未来」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'Know the future' → 纠正：'Predict the future'，因为'know'表示确切知道，而'predict'表示推测。

column1: 一个学生在科学课上做实验，老师要求他们根据实验数据推测结果。
column2: 学生希望通过观察实验中的变化，猜出接下来会发生什么。
column3: Based on the temperature drop, we can @ @ @ in this experiment.
column4: Based on the temperature drop, we can 「predict an outcome」 in this experiment.
column5: 根据温度下降，我们可以「预测结果」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'Guess the result' → 纠正：'Predict an outcome'，因为'guess'更随意，而'predict'基于证据更正式。

column1: 一位经理在公司会议上向团队保证新项目会取得好成绩，激励大家努力工作。
column2: 经理想要表达对项目前景的信心，让员工更有动力。
column3: With this strategy, I can confidently @ @ for our team.
column4: With this strategy, I can confidently 「predict success」 for our team.
column5: 有了这个策略，我可以自信地为我们的团队「预测成功」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'Say success will come' → 纠正：'Predict success'，因为'predict'更简洁且符合英语习惯。

column1: 一个时尚博主在社交媒体上发布视频，分享对明年流行色的看法。
column2: 博主根据今年的颜色趋势，推测明年会流行什么颜色。
column3: Based on this year’s styles, I’d @ @ @ for next season.
column4: Based on this year’s styles, I’d 「predict a trend」 for next season.
column5: 根据今年的风格，我会为下一季「预测趋势」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'Think about next trend' → 纠正：'Predict a trend'，因为'think about'过于模糊，而'predict'更具体。

column1: 小明在周末和朋友们一起去了一家娱乐场所，里面有很多老虎机和扑克桌。他看到很多人围着桌子，气氛非常热烈，决定尝试一下。他觉得自己可能会赢一些钱，但也知道有输钱的风险。
column2: 小明觉得这种活动既刺激又有点冒险，想试试自己的运气，同时也担心会上瘾。
column3: He was warned that @ @ could lead to serious financial issues if not controlled.
column4: He was warned that 「problem gambling」 could lead to serious financial issues if not controlled.
column5: 他被警告说「问题赌博」如果不加控制，可能会导致严重的财务问题。
column6: 典型中式英语：'He likes to gamble too much, it’s bad.' 纠正：'His excessive gambling could cause serious problems.'

column1: 小红在网上看到一个广告，宣传一种新的手机应用程序，可以随时随地参与各种投注游戏。她下载了这个应用，发现界面很吸引人，注册后开始小额下注，觉得既方便又有趣。
column2: 小红觉得这种方式很新奇，随时可以玩，但也担心自己可能会花太多时间和钱。
column3: She was excited to try @ @ on her phone but set a budget to stay safe.
column4: She was excited to try 「online gambling」 on her phone but set a budget to stay safe.
column5: 她很兴奋地在手机上尝试「在线赌博」，但设定了一个预算以确保安全。
column6: 典型中式英语：'She plays gambling on phone a lot.' 纠正：'She frequently engages in online gambling on her phone.'

column1: 小刚是一家初创公司的创始人，他决定将公司的大部分资金投入一个新产品的开发。这个产品在市场上还没有类似竞争者，但他相信这可能会带来巨大的回报，尽管也有失败的风险。
column2: 小刚认为这是一个大胆的决定，成功了就能让公司腾飞，失败了可能会让公司陷入困境。
column3: Investing all the funds in the new product was a @ @ @ for the startup.
column4: Investing all the funds in the new product was a 「big gamble」 for the startup.
column5: 将所有资金投入新产品对这家初创公司来说是一个「巨大的冒险」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'He gambles all money on new product.' 纠正：'He took a big gamble by investing all the funds in the new product.'

column1: 小丽是一个股票投资者，她听说一家小型科技公司即将发布一款创新产品。她决定投入一笔钱购买这家公司的股票，尽管她知道这个行业的波动性很大，可能会赚大钱，也可能会亏本。
column2: 小丽觉得这是一个有回报潜力的机会，但也明白这是一个需要谨慎考虑的冒险决定。
column3: Buying stocks in that company was a @ @, but she analyzed the risks carefully.
column4: Buying stocks in that company was a 「calculated gamble」, but she analyzed the risks carefully.
column5: 购买那家公司的股票是一个「经过计算的冒险」，但她仔细分析了风险。
column6: 典型中式英语：'She gambles on stocks with care.' 纠正：'She made a calculated gamble by carefully investing in stocks.'

column1: 你是一名大学生，需要在截止日期前将期末论文交给教授。教授要求论文通过学校的在线系统上传。
column2: 你完成了论文，想正式交给教授以便评分。
column3: You need to @ @ @ to the professor via the online portal before the deadline.
column4: You need to 「submit an application」 to the professor via the online portal before the deadline.
column5: 你需要在截止日期前通过在线门户向教授「提交申请」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'Give the application to the professor.' 纠正：'Submit the application to the professor.'（'Give'显得过于随意，'submit'更符合正式递交的语境。）

column1: 你是一家公司的员工，完成了一份市场分析报告，需要交给经理审阅。
column2: 你希望经理能看到你的工作成果，并提供反馈。
column3: Please @ @ @ to the manager by Friday for review.
column4: Please 「submit a report」 to the manager by Friday for review.
column5: 请在周五前向经理「提交报告」以供审阅。
column6: 典型中式英语：'Hand in the report to the manager.' 纠正：'Submit the report to the manager.'（'Hand in'更常用于学生作业，'submit'更适合正式工作场景。）

column1: 你在一个严格的公司工作，公司有许多规定，比如必须按时打卡上下班。你虽然不喜欢，但还是遵守了。
column2: 你选择接受公司的规定，即使你内心有些抵触。
column3: As an employee, you have to @ @ @ to maintain discipline.
column4: As an employee, you have to 「submit to authority」 to maintain discipline.
column5: 作为员工，你必须「服从权威」以保持纪律。
column6: 典型中式英语：'Follow the authority.' 纠正：'Submit to authority.'（'Follow'更多指跟随或遵守具体指示，'submit'强调接受权威的控制。）

column1: 你和朋友们在讨论去哪里度假，有人坚持要去海边，你最终同意了他们的选择。
column2: 你放弃了自己的想法，同意了大多数人的决定。
column3: After a long debate, you finally @ @ @ and agreed to go to the beach.
column4: After a long debate, you finally 「submit to pressure」 and agreed to go to the beach.
column5: 经过长时间争论，你最终「屈服于压力」，同意去海边。
column6: 典型中式英语：'Give in the pressure.' 纠正：'Submit to pressure.'（'Give in'虽然也表示让步，但搭配'to pressure'时'submit'更自然。）

column1: 一个家庭在周末计划一起度过欢乐时光，决定去市中心的剧院观看一场表演。
column2: 家人希望通过观看有趣的节目放松身心，享受共同的乐趣。
column3: The theater @ @ for all ages with its vibrant musical show.
column4: The theater 「provides entertainment」 for all ages with its vibrant musical show.
column5: 剧院通过其充满活力的音乐剧为所有年龄段的人「提供娱乐」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'The theater gives fun to people.' 纠正：'The theater provides entertainment for people.'（'give fun'不够自然，'provide entertainment'是更地道的表达。）

column1: 一个朋友聚会上，大家在客厅观看一场现场音乐表演，气氛热烈。
column2: 朋友们希望通过现场表演增添聚会的乐趣，享受音乐的魅力。
column3: The band offered @ @ that kept everyone dancing all night.
column4: The band offered 「live entertainment」 that kept everyone dancing all night.
column5: 乐队提供了「现场娱乐」，让大家整晚都在跳舞。
column6: 典型中式英语：'The band played lively music for fun.' 纠正：'The band offered live entertainment.'（'lively music for fun'不够具体，'live entertainment'更符合语境。）

column1: 一位商务人士在家中举办晚宴，邀请客户共进晚餐以促进合作。
column2: 主人希望通过精心准备的晚餐和活动让客户感到受到重视，增进关系。
column3: The CEO arranged @ @ to impress the new clients.
column4: The CEO arranged 「business entertainment」 to impress the new clients.
column5: 首席执行官安排了「商务招待」以给新客户留下深刻印象。
column6: 典型中式英语：'The CEO invited clients to eat for business.' 纠正：'The CEO arranged business entertainment for clients.'（'eat for business'过于直白，'business entertainment'更正式且地道。）

column1: 一个家庭邀请邻居到家中参加烧烤派对，分享美食和游戏。
column2: 主人希望通过热情的款待让邻居感到温暖，增强社区联系。
column3: They set up @ @ with a barbecue and music in their backyard.
column4: They set up 「home entertainment」 with a barbecue and music in their backyard.
column5: 他们在后院用烧烤和音乐安排了「家庭招待」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'They made a party at home for neighbors.' 纠正：'They set up home entertainment for neighbors.'（'made a party'不够具体，'home entertainment'更贴合款待的含义。）

column1: 在公司会议中，经理对团队提交的项目报告提出质疑，认为内容不够详尽。
column2: 经理觉得报告有很多不足之处，直接表达了不满。
column3: The manager was @ @ the team's report, pointing out several flaws.
column4: The manager was 「critical of」 the team's report, pointing out several flaws.
column5: 经理对团队的报告「持批评态度」，指出了几个缺陷。
column6: 典型中式英语：'The manager criticized to the report.' 纠正：'The manager was critical of the report.'（'criticize'是动词，'critical'是形容词，搭配介词'of'更自然。）

column1: 在家庭聚会上，姑姑对侄子的职业选择发表意见，认为他应该选更稳定的工作。
column2: 姑姑觉得侄子的选择不明智，语气中带有强烈的批评。
column3: My aunt was @ @ about my career path, saying it was too risky.
column4: My aunt was 「highly critical」 about my career path, saying it was too risky.
column5: 姑姑对我的职业道路「极为挑剔」，说它太冒险了。
column6: 典型中式英语：'My aunt very criticized my career.' 纠正：'My aunt was highly critical of my career.'（避免用'very criticized'，用'highly critical'更地道。）

column1: 在一场国际谈判中，团队需要在最后一天达成协议，否则合作将失败。
column2: 团队的努力在最后一天尤为重要，直接影响谈判结果。
column3: The team's effort played a @ @ in securing the deal on the final day.
column4: The team's effort played a 「critical role」 in securing the deal on the final day.
column5: 团队的努力在最后一天「发挥了关键作用」，确保了协议的达成。
column6: 典型中式英语：'The team's effort was very important role.' 纠正：'The team's effort played a critical role.'（'important role'太平淡，'critical role'更强调关键性。）

column1: 在医院的手术室中，医生需要在几分钟内做出决定以挽救患者生命。
column2: 医生的快速决策在紧急情况下尤为重要。
column3: The doctor's decision was a @ @ in saving the patient's life.
column4: The doctor's decision was a 「critical factor」 in saving the patient's life.
column5: 医生的决定是挽救患者生命的「关键因素」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'The doctor's decision was very key.' 纠正：'The doctor's decision was a critical factor.'（'very key'不地道，'critical factor'更精确。）

column1: 车祸后，伤者被紧急送往医院，医生表示情况非常危险。
column2: 伤者的生命体征不稳定，随时可能恶化。
column3: After the accident, the patient was in a @ @ and needed immediate surgery.
column4: After the accident, the patient was in a 「critical condition」 and needed immediate surgery.
column5: 事故后，患者处于「危急状态」，需要立即手术。
column6: 典型中式英语：'The patient was very dangerous condition.' 纠正：'The patient was in a critical condition.'（'dangerous condition'不准确，'critical condition'是医学术语。）

column1: 工厂发生重大设备故障，可能导致生产全面停工。
column2: 设备问题非常严重，可能会影响整个生产流程。
column3: The equipment failure created a @ @ that threatened the entire production line.
column4: The equipment failure created a 「critical situation」 that threatened the entire production line.
column5: 设备故障造成了一个「危急情况」，威胁到整个生产线。
column6: 典型中式英语：'The failure made a very urgent situation.' 纠正：'The failure created a critical situation.'（'urgent'不够具体，'critical situation'更贴合语境。）

column1: 你在一家咖啡店买了一杯拿铁，店员扫描你的手机支付二维码，交易迅速完成。
column2: 你想表达支付过程很快，交易已经成功结束。
column3: The barista scanned my phone and @ @ @ in seconds.
column4: The barista scanned my phone and 「completed a transaction」 in seconds.
column5: 店员扫描了我的手机，秒内「完成了一笔交易」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'Finish the pay quickly.' 纠正：'Complete the transaction quickly.'

column1: 你在网上购买一双鞋，支付平台处理你的信用卡信息，确保资金安全转移。
column2: 你想说明支付系统正在处理你的付款，确保交易顺利。
column3: The website took a moment to @ @ @ securely.
column4: The website took a moment to 「process a transaction」 securely.
column5: 网站花了一点时间「处理一笔交易」以确保安全。
column6: 典型中式英语：'The website deal with my payment.' 纠正：'The website processes my payment.'

column1: 你正在开发一个电商网站，数据库需要确保用户支付后库存减少，这需要一个完整的事务处理。
column2: 你想表达数据库正在运行一系列操作，以确保数据一致。
column3: The system needs to @ @ @ to update the inventory and payment records.
column4: The system needs to 「execute a transaction」 to update the inventory and payment records.
column5: 系统需要「执行一个事务」来更新库存和支付记录。
column6: 典型中式英语：'The system do a transaction.' 纠正：'The system executes a transaction.'

column1: 你在测试一个银行应用，如果转账过程中出现错误，系统会撤销操作以避免数据错误。
column2: 你想说明系统会取消失败的操作，以保持数据完整。
column3: If an error occurs, the database will @ @ @ to prevent inconsistencies.
column4: If an error occurs, the database will 「rollback a transaction」 to prevent inconsistencies.
column5: 如果发生错误，数据库会「回滚一个事务」以防止数据不一致。
column6: 典型中式英语：'The database cancel the transaction.' 纠正：'The database rolls back the transaction.'

column1: 小明计划去欧洲旅行，他想从上海飞往巴黎，但不想直飞，因为他希望在途中游览另一个城市。
column2: 小明想通过某个城市中转，既能节省费用，又能顺便游玩。
column3: He decided to @ @ London to save on flight costs and explore the city.
column4: He decided to 「travel via」 London to save on flight costs and explore the city.
column5: 他决定「通过伦敦」旅行，以节省航班费用并游览这座城市。
column6: 典型中式英语：He go to Paris pass by London. 纠正：He travels to Paris via London.

column1: 小红在公司需要发送一份紧急文件给客户，但客户在另一个国家，她选择使用电子邮件以确保快速送达。
column2: 小红希望通过电子邮件快速、安全地将文件发送给客户。
column3: She sent the document @ @ email to ensure it reached the client quickly.
column4: She sent the document 「via email」 to ensure it reached the client quickly.
column5: 她「通过电子邮件」发送了文件，以确保客户能快速收到。
column6: 典型中式英语：She send file by email. 纠正：She sent the file via email.

column1: 张伟计划从北京开车到上海，但他想顺路去杭州看朋友，所以选择了一条经过杭州的路线。
column2: 张伟想通过杭州的路线，既能探望朋友，又能享受沿途风景。
column3: He chose to @ @ Hangzhou to visit friends and enjoy the scenic route.
column4: He chose to 「go via」 Hangzhou to visit friends and enjoy the scenic route.
column5: 他选择「经由杭州」去，既能探望朋友，又能享受沿途风景。
column6: 典型中式英语：He go to Shanghai through Hangzhou. 纠正：He goes to Shanghai via Hangzhou.

column1: 一家公司需要将货物从广州运到美国，物流经理决定通过海运并在新加坡中转以降低成本。
column2: 物流经理希望通过新加坡的港口运输货物，以优化成本和时间。
column3: The goods were @ @ Singapore to reduce shipping costs.
column4: The goods were 「shipped via」 Singapore to reduce shipping costs.
column5: 货物「经由新加坡」运输，以降低运输成本。
column6: 典型中式英语：Goods send by Singapore. 纠正：Goods were shipped via Singapore.

column1: 在一家餐厅，顾客发现食物不符合预期，向服务员提出要求。
column2: 顾客对食物质量不满意，强烈要求更换菜品，不接受服务员的解释。
column3: The customer @ @ @ a new dish because the one served was cold.
column4: The customer 「insisted on」 getting a new dish because the one served was cold.
column5: 顾客「坚持要求」换一道新菜，因为端上来的菜是冷的。
column6: 中式英语：He strongly asked to change the dish. 纠正：He insisted on getting a new dish.

column1: 在公司会议中，经理对团队的工作进度不满意，提出明确要求。
column2: 经理认为项目进度落后，要求团队必须加班完成任务。
column3: The manager @ @ @ the project be completed by Friday.
column4: The manager 「insisted that」 the project be completed by Friday.
column5: 经理「坚持要求」项目必须在周五之前完成。
column6: 中式英语：The manager said the project must finish by Friday. 纠正：The manager insisted that the project be completed by Friday.

column1: 在朋友聚会中，有人误解了某人的行为，引发争论。
column2: 某人被误认为说谎，坚定地声明自己没有做错任何事。
column3: Despite the accusations, she @ @ @ she was telling the truth.
column4: Despite the accusations, she 「insisted that」 she was telling the truth.
column5: 尽管被指责，她「坚持说」自己说的是真话。
column6: 中式英语：She said strongly she didn’t lie. 纠正：She insisted that she was telling the truth.

column1: 在法庭上，嫌疑人面对指控，试图为自己辩护。
column2: 嫌疑人面对证据 Roscoe insists that he is not guilty.
column3: Even under pressure, he @ @ @ his innocence.
column4: Even under pressure, he 「insisted on」 his innocence.
column5: 即使在压力下，他「坚持说」自己无罪。
column6: 中式英语：He said he is not guilty. 纠正：He insisted on his innocence.

column1: 小明在图书馆准备期末考试，但旁边桌子的讨论声不断干扰他。
column2: 小明试图专注于复习，但外界的噪音让他无法集中精神。
column3: The loud conversation at the next table @ @ @ his studying.
column4: The loud conversation at the next table 「distracted him from」 his studying.
column5: 旁边桌子的喧闹谈话「使他从学习中分心」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'The noise made him cannot focus on study.' 纠正：'The noise distracted him from studying.'（使用'distract from'表达分心，并避免'cannot focus'的生硬表达。）

column1: 公司会议上，经理正在讨论季度目标，但窗外的施工噪音让大家难以专心。
column2: 施工噪音吸引了与会者的注意力，导致他们无法专注于会议内容。
column3: The construction noise outside @ @ @ the meeting’s agenda.
column4: The construction noise outside 「distracted attention from」 the meeting’s agenda.
column5: 窗外的施工噪音「使注意力从会议议程上分散」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'The noise let us not concentrate the meeting.' 纠正：'The noise distracted attention from the meeting.'（使用'distract attention from'，并修正语序和表达。）

column1: 小红刚和男友分手，心情低落，她决定去看一部喜剧电影来缓解情绪。
column2: 小红想通过看电影让自己暂时忘记失恋的痛苦。
column3: She watched a comedy movie to @ @ @ her breakup.
column4: She watched a comedy movie to 「distract herself with」 her breakup.
column5: 她看了一部喜剧电影来「让自己从分手中分心」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'She watched movie to forget her sad.' 纠正：'She watched a movie to distract herself from her sadness.'（使用'distract oneself from'，并改进'forget her sad'的表达。）

column1: 小刚因为工作压力大，晚上睡不着，他开始玩手机游戏来放松。
column2: 小刚通过玩游戏来暂时忘记工作的压力。
column3: He played mobile games to @ @ @ his work stress.
column4: He played mobile games to 「distract himself with」 his work stress.
column5: 他玩手机游戏来「让自己从工作压力中分心」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'He played games to not think work.' 纠正：'He played games to distract himself from work stress.'（使用'distract from'，并修正语义不清的表达。）

column1: 一个房地产开发商在城市郊区购买了一大片土地，计划将其分割成多个小型住宅区，供家庭购买建房。
column2: 开发商想要把大片土地分成适合家庭居住的小块区域，每个区域都有自己的房子和花园。
column3: The developer planned to build a @ @ on the outskirts of the city.
column4: The developer planned to build a 「residential subdivision」 on the outskirts of the city.
column5: 开发商计划在城市郊区建设一个「住宅小区」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'The developer wants to build a small living area.' 纠正：'The developer plans to build a residential subdivision.'（避免模糊的'living area'，使用更具体的'subdivision'）

column1: 地方政府决定将一块公共土地分割成几个部分，以便更好地规划城市发展，包括住宅、商业和公园区域。
column2: 政府希望通过划分土地来优化城市布局，确保每个部分都有明确用途。
column3: The city council approved a plan to @ @ for mixed-use development.
column4: The city council approved a plan to 「create a subdivision」 for mixed-use development.
column5: 市议会批准了一项计划，旨在「创建分区」以进行混合用途开发。
column6: 典型中式英语：'The city wants to make a division for development.' 纠正：'The city plans to create a subdivision for development.'（'make a division'不够地道，'create a subdivision'更符合英语习惯）

column1: 在中国的一个省内，为了更有效地管理地方事务，政府将省划分为多个市和县。
column2: 省政府希望通过设立更小的行政单位来提高管理效率。
column3: The province was divided into several @ @ for better governance.
column4: The province was divided into several 「administrative subdivisions」 for better governance.
column5: 该省被划分为几个「行政区划」以实现更好的治理。
column6: 典型中式英语：'The province is cut into small parts for management.' 纠正：'The province is divided into administrative subdivisions for management.'（'cut into small parts'过于直译，'divided into subdivisions'更自然）

column1: 一家大型跨国公司决定将其研发部门细分为多个小组，每个小组专注于不同技术领域。
column2: 公司希望通过将部门分成更小的单位来提高研发效率和专业化程度。
column3: The company restructured its R&D department into multiple @ @ to enhance innovation.
column4: The company restructured its R&D department into multiple 「organizational subdivisions」 to enhance innovation.
column5: 公司将其研发部门重组为多个「组织分支」以提升创新能力。
column6: 典型中式英语：'The company divided its department into small groups.' 纠正：'The company restructured its department into organizational subdivisions.'（'small groups'不够正式，'organizational subdivisions'更贴合语境）

column1: 一个中国农民在春季检查自己的稻田，观察水稻的生长情况，希望今年能有好的收成。
column2: 农民希望通过精心的耕作和施肥，让稻田生产更多的稻米。
column3: With improved farming techniques, the fields produced a @ @ this year.
column4: With improved farming techniques, the fields produced a 「high yield」 this year.
column5: 通过改进农业技术，田地今年生产了「高产量」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'The fields give many rice.' 纠正：'The fields produced a high yield of rice.'

column1: 一位农业科学家在实验室中分析不同土壤对小麦生长的影响，记录每块实验田的收成数据。
column2: 科学家希望通过实验找到能让小麦产出更多的土壤类型。
column3: The new soil composition significantly increased the @ @ in our experiments.
column4: The new soil composition significantly increased the 「crop yield」 in our experiments.
column5: 新的土壤成分显著提高了我们实验中的「作物产量」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'The soil makes more wheat.' 纠正：'The soil composition increased the crop yield.'

column1: 一位中国投资者在研究股票市场，决定投资一家科技公司，希望获得长期回报。
column2: 投资者希望通过购买股票获得可观的财务回报。
column3: Her investment in the tech startup began to @ @ @ after two years.
column4: Her investment in the tech startup began to 「yield a profit」 after two years.
column5: 她在科技初创公司的投资两年后开始「产生利润」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'Her money gives profit.' 纠正：'Her investment yielded a profit.'

column1: 一家公司实施新的员工培训计划，希望提高团队效率和协作能力。
column2: 公司希望培训能带来更好的工作表现和团队合作。
column3: The training program is expected to @ @ for the entire team.
column4: The training program is expected to 「yield benefits」 for the entire team.
column5: 培训计划预计将为整个团队「带来益处」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'The training makes good results.' 纠正：'The training yields benefits.'

column1: 在家庭聚会上，父母与青少年孩子争论假期计划，父母最终妥协，同意孩子的选择。
column2: 父母不想继续争吵，决定顺从孩子的意愿。
column3: After hours of debate, the parents finally @ @ @ from their son.
column4: After hours of debate, the parents finally 「yielded to demands」 from their son.
column5: 经过数小时的争论，父母最终「屈服于儿子的要求」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'Parents agree with son’s ask.' 纠正：'The parents yielded to their son’s demands.'

column1: 在商务谈判中，一家公司面对客户的强烈反对，决定在价格上做出让步。
column2: 公司为了达成交易，愿意在某些条件上妥协。
column3: To secure the deal, the company had to @ @ to the client’s objections.
column4: To secure the deal, the company had to 「yield ground」 to the client’s objections.
column5: 为了达成交易，公司不得不对客户的反对意见「让步」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'The company gives up to client.' 纠正：'The company yielded ground to the client.'

column1: 在工作场所，小明收到一封来自外国同事的电子邮件，邮件中提到‘Let’s wrap this up by Friday.’ 小明以为是要在周五前完成所有工作，但其实同事的意思是希望在周五前确认项目的初步计划。
column2: 小明错误地理解了同事的意图，以为是要完成全部任务，而不是仅仅确认计划。
column3: He @ @ @ when he thought the email meant finishing the entire project by Friday.
column4: He 「misunderstood someone's intentions」 when he thought the email meant finishing the entire project by Friday.
column5: 他「误解了别人的意图」，以为邮件的意思是要在周五前完成整个项目。
column6: 典型中式英语：'He wrong understood the email.' 纠正：'He misunderstood the email.'

column1: 在英语课堂上，老师要求学生‘Summarize the article in your own words.’ 小红以为老师是要逐字翻译文章，而不是用自己的语言概括内容。
column2: 小红错误地理解了老师的要求，以为是翻译而不是总结。
column3: She @ @ @ by translating the article word for word instead of summarizing it.
column4: She 「misunderstood the situation」 by translating the article word for word instead of summarizing it.
column5: 她「误解了情况」，逐字翻译了文章而不是总结。
column6: 典型中式英语：'She mistake the teacher's meaning.' 纠正：'She misunderstood the teacher's instructions.'

column1: 小刚参加一个国际象棋比赛，裁判说‘Touch-move rule applies.’ 小刚以为这意味着他可以随意移动棋子，但实际上规则要求触摸棋子后必须移动它。
column2: 小刚错误地理解了比赛规则，以为可以自由移动棋子，而不是必须移动触摸的棋子。
column3: He @ @ @ and moved pieces freely during the chess match.
column4: He 「misunderstood the rules」 and moved pieces freely during the chess match.
column5: 他「误解了规则」，在国际象棋比赛中随意移动棋子。
column6: 典型中式英语：'He not understand the rule correctly.' 纠正：'He misunderstood the rule.'

column1: 小丽在导航软件上看到‘Turn left in 200 meters.’ 她以为是立刻左转，结果错过了正确的路口。
column2: 小丽错误地理解了导航的指示，以为是立即左转，而不是在200米后左转。
column3: She @ @ @ and turned left too early while driving.
column4: She 「misunderstood directions」 and turned left too early while driving.
column5: 她「误解了方向」，开车时过早左转。
column6: 典型中式英语：'She mistake the navigation.' 纠正：'She misunderstood the navigation instructions.'

column1: 在一次团队会议中，项目经理需要说服团队选择一个更高效的工作流程。经理通过分析数据和因果关系来说明新流程的优点。
column2: 通过清晰的因果分析，让大家理解为什么新流程更合理。
column3: To convince the team, the manager had to @ @ to explain the benefits of the new workflow.
column4: To convince the team, the manager had to 「apply logic」 to explain the benefits of the new workflow.
column5: 为了说服团队，经理需要「运用逻辑」来解释新工作流程的好处。
column6: 典型中式英语：'Use logic thinking to explain.' 纠正：'Apply logic to explain.' 中式英语常直接翻译'逻辑思维'，显得冗余，改为'apply logic'更简洁自然。

column1: 在课堂上，老师要求学生分析一篇议论文的论点是否合理。学生通过检查论点的因果链条，发现其中的漏洞。
column2: 通过检查论点的合理性，判断其是否站得住脚。
column3: The student pointed out that the argument didn’t @ @ because of inconsistent reasoning.
column4: The student pointed out that the argument didn’t 「follow logic」 because of inconsistent reasoning.
column5: 学生指出，由于推理不一致，该论点没有「遵循逻辑」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'The argument is not logic.' 纠正：'The argument doesn’t follow logic.' 中式英语常误用'logic'作形容词，正确表达是用'follow logic'表示符合逻辑。

column1: 一位程序员在开发一个电商网站时，需要设计一个自动推荐商品的功能。他通过编写代码来定义推荐的规则。
column2: 通过代码设置规则，确保推荐系统能根据用户行为作出合理推荐。
column3: The developer spent hours refining the @ @ to improve the website’s recommendation system.
column4: The developer spent hours refining the 「programming logic」 to improve the website’s recommendation system.
column5: 开发人员花了几个小时优化「编程逻辑」，以改进网站的推荐系统。
column6: 典型中式英语：'Write the logic of program.' 纠正：'Refine the programming logic.' 中式英语常直接翻译'程序的逻辑'，显得不地道，正确表达是用'programming logic'。

column1: 在设计一个新的库存管理系统时，团队需要确保系统能自动处理订单和库存更新。他们讨论了系统的核心规则。
column2: 确保系统的核心规则能无缝处理订单和库存更新。
column3: The team carefully designed the @ @ to ensure seamless order and inventory management.
column4: The team carefully designed the 「business logic」 to ensure seamless order and inventory management.
column5: 团队仔细设计了「业务逻辑」，以确保订单和库存管理的无缝衔接。
column6: 典型中式英语：'The logic of business is designed.' 纠正：'The business logic is designed.' 中式英语常误用'logic of business'，正确表达是'business logic'。

column1: 在一次工作会议中，经理正在向团队介绍新项目的计划，要求大家关注具体步骤。
column2: 经理希望团队不仅了解项目的整体目标，还要深入了解每个步骤的具体内容。
column3: The manager asked us to discuss the project @ @ to ensure everyone understands the process.
column4: The manager asked us to discuss the project 「in detail」 to ensure everyone understands the process.
column5: 经理要求我们「详细地」讨论项目，以确保每个人都理解流程。
column6: 典型中式英语：'Discuss the project very detailed.' 纠正：'Discuss the project in detail.'

column1: 一位朋友在咖啡馆分享她最近的旅行经历，特别提到了一些有趣的小故事。
column2: 朋友想通过分享具体的经历，让听者感受到旅行的乐趣。
column3: She described her trip to Italy @ @ @, sharing stories about the local culture.
column4: She described her trip to Italy 「in fine detail」, sharing stories about the local culture.
column5: 她「非常详细地」描述了意大利之旅，分享了当地文化的故事。
column6: 典型中式英语：'She talked her trip very detail.' 纠正：'She described her trip in detail.'

column1: 一位工程师在技术会议上向客户解释新产品的开发流程。
column2: 工程师需要清楚地说明每个开发阶段的具体步骤，以赢得客户的信任。
column3: The engineer was asked to @ @ @ to clarify each step for the client.
column4: The engineer was asked to 「detail the process」 to clarify each step for the client.
column5: 工程师被要求「详细说明流程」，以便为客户澄清每个步骤。
column6: 典型中式英语：'Explain the process very detailed.' 纠正：'Detail the process clearly.'

column1: 一位老师在课堂上向学生解释一项复杂的作业要求。
column2: 老师希望通过清晰的说明，让学生明白作业的具体要求和评分标准。
column3: The teacher took time to @ @ @ so students could start the assignment confidently.
column4: The teacher took time to 「detail the requirements」 so students could start the assignment confidently.
column5: 老师花时间「详细说明要求」，以便学生能够自信地开始作业。
column6: 典型中式英语：'Teacher said the requirements very detail.' 纠正：'The teacher detailed the requirements clearly.'

column1: 一位母亲在孩子的毕业典礼上，看着孩子走上领奖台，内心充满了无法言喻的情感。
column2: 母亲觉得自己的幸福和骄傲是如此巨大，仿佛无法用任何标准来衡量。
column3: Her heart swelled with @ @ as she watched her child receive the diploma.
column4: Her heart swelled with 「immeasurable joy」 as she watched her child receive the diploma.
column5: 她的心因「无法测量的喜悦」而膨胀，看着孩子领取毕业证书。
column6: 典型中式英语：'Her happiness is very big.' 纠正：'Her happiness is immeasurable.'

column1: 一家公司在推出环保产品后，收到了全球用户的积极反馈，影响力超出了预期。
column2: 公司意识到他们的产品对环境和社会的正面作用是如此深远，难以用数据统计。
column3: The new eco-friendly product had an @ @ on global sustainability efforts.
column4: The new eco-friendly product had an 「immeasurable impact」 on global sustainability efforts.
column5: 这款新环保产品对全球可持续发展努力产生了「无法测量的影响」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'The product affects the environment very much.' 纠正：'The product has an immeasurable impact on the environment.'

column1: 一个年轻人在夜晚仰望星空，思考宇宙的浩瀚，感到人类的渺小。
column2: 他觉得星星之间的距离是如此遥远，仿佛没有任何工具可以丈量。
column3: The stars seemed separated by an @ @ that humbled him.
column4: The stars seemed separated by an 「immeasurable distance」 that humbled him.
column5: 星星之间仿佛被「无边的距离」隔开，让他感到谦卑。
column6: 典型中式英语：'The distance of stars is very far.' 纠正：'The distance between the stars is immeasurable.'

column1: 一位创业者在规划公司未来时，意识到团队的创造力和可能性无穷无尽。
column2: 她相信团队的能力没有上限，未来的成就可能是无限的。
column3: She believed her team had @ @ to achieve greatness.
column4: She believed her team had 「immeasurable potential」 to achieve greatness.
column5: 她相信她的团队有「无限的潜力」去成就伟大。
column6: 典型中式英语：'Her team has very big potential.' 纠正：'Her team has immeasurable potential.'

column1: 在一场公司会议中，项目经理需要向团队解释为什么新的工作流程会提高效率。团队成员起初对此持怀疑态度，但经理通过数据和实例成功地说服了大家。
column2: 经理通过清晰的逻辑和有力的证据让团队相信新流程是可行的。
column3: The manager presented @ @ @ that won over the skeptical team.
column4: The manager presented 「a convincing argument」 that won over the skeptical team.
column5: 经理提出了「一个有说服力的论点」，赢得了持怀疑态度的团队的认同。
column6: 典型中式英语：'The manager said a very strong reason.' 纠正：'The manager presented a convincing argument.'（'reason'不如'argument'具体，且'strong'不如'convincing'准确传达说服力。）

column1: 在一场学校辩论赛中，一位学生通过引用可靠的研究数据和现实案例，成功地让评委相信她的观点是正确的。
column2: 学生用事实和逻辑让评委觉得她的立场更有道理。
column3: Her @ @ @ left the judges with no doubts about her position.
column4: Her 「convincing performance」 left the judges with no doubts about her position.
column5: 她的「令人信服的表现」让评委对她的立场毫无疑问。
column6: 典型中式英语：'Her speech was very good.' 纠正：'Her performance was convincing.'（'good'过于笼统，'convincing performance'更具体地表达了说服力。）

column1: 在一场足球比赛中，主队以5比0的比分击败了对手，展现了他们强大的实力。观众和评论员都认为这场胜利非常震撼。
column2: 主队以巨大的优势获胜，让人完全认可他们的实力。
column3: The home team secured @ @ @ that stunned the audience.
column4: The home team secured 「a convincing victory」 that stunned the audience.
column5: 主队取得了「压倒性的胜利」，让观众震惊。
column6: 典型中式英语：'The team won very big.' 纠正：'The team secured a convincing victory.'（'very big'不地道，'convincing victory'更准确表达压倒性。）

column1: 在一场全国象棋锦标赛中，一位年轻选手在决赛中以显著的优势击败了经验丰富的对手，赢得了冠军。
column2: 年轻选手以绝对的优势获胜，证明了自己的实力。
column3: The young player achieved @ @ @ against a seasoned opponent.
column4: The young player achieved 「a convincing win」 against a seasoned opponent.
column5: 这位年轻选手对阵经验丰富的对手取得了「显著的胜利」。
column6: 典型中式英语：'The player won very strongly.' 纠正：'The player achieved a convincing win.'（'strongly'不适合描述胜利，'convincing win'更自然。）

column1: 一个大学生在学校组织的慈善活动中，看到宣传板上写着需要为贫困地区的儿童筹集资金。他决定贡献自己的一部分零花钱。
column2: 他想通过贡献自己的零花钱来帮助那些需要帮助的孩子，觉得这是一件有意义的事情。
column3: He decided to @ @ @ to help children in need.
column4: He decided to 「donate to a charity」 to help children in need.
column5: 他决定「捐款给慈善机构」来帮助有需要的儿童。
column6: 典型中式英语：He wants to give money to charity. 纠正：He wants to donate to a charity.（'give money' 显得笼统，'donate' 更精确且常见。）

column1: 一位职场人士在公司组织的公益活动中，听说可以通过定期捐款支持环保项目，决定每月从工资中拿出一部分。
column2: 她希望通过定期贡献一部分收入来支持环境保护，觉得这对社会有益。
column3: She signed up to @ @ every month to support environmental projects.
column4: She signed up to 「donate money」 every month to support environmental projects.
column5: 她报名每月「捐款」来支持环保项目。
column6: 典型中式英语：She will give some money every month. 纠正：She will donate money every month.（'give' 不够正式，'donate' 更适合公益场景。）

column1: 一个年轻人在社区医院看到献血车的宣传，了解到献血可以帮助急需输血的病人。他决定参与。
column2: 他觉得献出自己的血液可以救人，是一件很有价值的行为。
column3: He volunteered to @ @ to help save lives.
column4: He volunteered to 「donate blood」 to help save lives.
column5: 他自愿「献血」来帮助救人。
column6: 典型中式英语：He wants to give his blood. 纠正：He wants to donate blood.（'give blood' 不自然，'donate blood' 是固定搭配。）

column1: 一位中年人在了解了器官捐献的重要性后，决定签署协议，承诺在去世后将自己的器官用于救助他人。
column2: 他希望即使在生命结束后，也能通过贡献器官来帮助他人延续生命。
column3: He signed a pledge to @ @ after his passing.
column4: He signed a pledge to 「donate organs」 after his passing.
column5: 他签署了一份承诺书，在去世后「捐献器官」。
column6: 典型中式英语：He will give his organs. 纠正：He will donate his organs.（'give organs' 不地道，'donate organs' 是标准表达。）

column1: 一位退休教师听说社区图书馆需要志愿者帮助整理书籍和教孩子们阅读，她决定每周花几个小时参与。
column2: 她希望通过贡献自己的时间和教学经验来帮助社区的孩子们培养阅读兴趣。
column3: She offered to @ @ to help children improve their reading.
column4: She offered to 「donate time」 to help children improve their reading.
column5: 她主动提出「贡献时间」来帮助孩子们提高阅读能力。
column6: 典型中式英语：She wants to give her time to the library. 纠正：She wants to donate her time to the library.（'give time' 不常见，'donate time' 更自然。）

column1: 一位平面设计师在朋友的非营利组织活动中，主动提出为他们的宣传活动设计海报。
column2: 他希望通过贡献自己的专业技能来支持朋友的事业，同时展示自己的设计能力。
column3: He agreed to @ @ to create posters for the event.
column4: He agreed to 「donate skills」 to create posters for the event.
column5: 他同意「贡献技能」为活动设计海报。
column6: 典型中式英语：He will give his skills to the event. 纠正：He will donate his skills to the event.（'give skills' 不地道，'donate skills' 更符合英语习惯。）

column1: 在大学课堂上，教授要求学生们分析两种不同的经济理论。学生们需要通过对比两者的优缺点来加深理解。
column2: 通过比较两种理论的异同，帮助学生更清楚地理解它们的适用场景和局限性。
column3: In the lecture, the professor asked us to @ @ the Keynesian and Classical economic theories.
column4: In the lecture, the professor asked us to 「compare with」 the Keynesian and Classical economic theories.
column5: 在课堂上，教授要求我们「比较」凯恩斯主义和古典经济学理论。
column6: Chinglish: 'Make a compare about two theories.' Correct: 'Compare the two theories.'

column1: 在一次朋友聚会上，大家讨论各自旅行的经历，分享不同城市的特点，比如风景、文化和美食。
column2: 通过分享旅行的见闻，朋友们想了解不同城市之间的相似点和独特之处。
column3: During the gathering, we @ @ the beauty of Paris and Kyoto.
column4: During the gathering, we 「compared to」 the beauty of Paris and Kyoto.
column5: 在聚会上，我们「比较了」巴黎和京都的美景。
column6: Chinglish: 'We compare Paris with Kyoto about beauty.' Correct: 'We compared the beauty of Paris to Kyoto.'

column1: 在一个文学研讨会上，学生们讨论莎士比亚的比喻手法，分析他如何用自然意象来表达人类情感。
column2: 通过将人的情感比作自然现象，莎士比亚让读者更深刻地感受到情感的强烈。
column3: In his sonnet, Shakespeare @ @ the lover’s beauty @ the brightness of a summer’s day.
column4: In his sonnet, Shakespeare 「compares to」 the lover’s beauty 「to」 the brightness of a summer’s day.
column5: 在他的十四行诗中，莎士比亚将爱人的美貌「比作」夏日的明亮。
column6: Chinglish: 'He compare beauty as summer day.' Correct: 'He compares her beauty to a summer’s day.'

column1: 在一次演讲中，演说者用比喻来激励听众，描述坚持不懈的重要性。
column2: 通过将坚持比作攀登高峰，演说者让听众感受到努力的价值和成就感。
column3: The speaker @ @ perseverance @ climbing a steep mountain.
column4: The speaker 「compared to」 perseverance 「to」 climbing a steep mountain.
column5: 演讲者将毅力「比作」攀登陡峭的高山。
column6: Chinglish: 'Perseverance is compare with mountain climbing.' Correct: 'Perseverance is compared to climbing a mountain.'

column1: 在一家咖啡店，顾客们讨论不同品牌的咖啡豆，比较哪一种口感更好。
column2: 通过品尝和讨论，顾客们想找出哪款咖啡豆在味道上更胜一筹。
column3: This artisanal coffee @ @ the mass-produced brands in terms of flavor.
column4: This artisanal coffee 「compares with」 the mass-produced brands in terms of flavor.
column5: 这种手工咖啡在口感上可以「与」量产品牌媲美。
column6: Chinglish: 'This coffee compare to others is better.' Correct: 'This coffee compares favorably with others.'

column1: 在家庭聚会上，母亲回忆起童年的家乡美食，感叹现在的餐厅难以企及。
column2: 母亲通过回忆表达对家乡味道的怀念，觉得现代食物无法与之相比。
column3: The taste of my mother’s cooking is unique; @ @ @ modern restaurants.
column4: The taste of my mother’s cooking is unique; 「nothing compares to」 it in modern restaurants.
column5: 妈妈做的菜味道独特，现代餐厅里「没有能与之相比」的。
column6: Chinglish: 'No restaurant can compare her cooking.' Correct: 'Nothing compares to her cooking.'

column1: 在一个繁忙的周六早晨，李明正在超市购物。他拿着一张购物清单，上面列着需要购买的各种东西。他站在货架前，核对清单上的每一条。
column2: 李明想确保自己买齐清单上的每件东西，所以他逐一确认并放入购物车。
column3: He decided to @ @ @ to his shopping list because he noticed they were out of milk.
column4: He decided to 「add an item」 to his shopping list because he noticed they were out of milk.
column5: 他决定「添加一个条目」到他的购物清单上，因为他发现家里没牛奶了。
column6: 典型中式英语：'He added one thing to his list.' 纠正：'Add one thing' 不够具体，英语中更常说 「add an item」 来指代清单上的条目。

column1: 在一家服装店里，张丽正在整理自己的购物篮。她试穿了几件衣服后，决定只买其中的一件，因为预算有限。
column2: 张丽在检查购物篮里的东西时，决定去掉一件不那么需要的衣服，以节省开支。
column3: She chose to @ @ @ from her basket to stay within her budget.
